PzSR8sA7dWWeRZPQtzdxow.text: This place is really good for all you can eat. Me and my wife come here once a month and when my father in law is in town he always makes it a point for us to go here. He always says that place with all the meat is bad ass. The quality is good for all you can eat. If your looking for really fancy Korean bbq this is not the place for you. It's even better since they upped the bear selection.

bK3-n_RLB7lRLkf9WmOYTQ.text: Gen - How have I lived my life without you? You are my one True love. Check this place out and get the red wine pork belly, thank me later.

XKlHnaajo5IJzctVUOpF3Q.text: Love this place. Same quality as the ones in L.A. One of the best AYCE. A bit too much sauce on the spicey chicken and octopus but other than that awesome.

E5qwqaxZTfIOKS-Tn2iAcA.text: This was my first time ever eating at this place and it started off great. My first problem was that I had trouble using chopsticks. I tried, but after a few minutes we asked for a fork. We were told they would bring it right out for me. A few minutes past and still no fork so we ask again. Now with an annoyed look by our server he says yes, but never returns with the fork! We ask for the 3rd time, get told yes and he still never brings it out. We give up and I continue to struggle with the chopsticks to eat my rice, and I just use my fingers to grab the meat! After a couple of servings I looked at the sauce I had been served and saw what looked like antennas. I looked closer and saw that there was a moth type of bug floating in it. We immediately told our server and after he closely investigated the sauce himself, he asked me if it was there the whole time. He takes the sauce away and brings me out a fresh one. No apology at all!! Now my friend and I are grossed out. After sitting there another server sees our expression, notices that we aren't eating then comes over and asks if everything is alright. I tell him no, there was a bug in my sauce, and that we are disgusted. He apologizes and proceeds to get the manager. The manager comes over and asks us what's going on. We explain what the problem was and he asks us if we know what time the bug got into the sauce!! How the heck are we supposed to know? It looked just like the flakes from whatever seasoning they put in it, so it wasn't noticed right away! The only reason I did notice was because I happen to see the antennas which made me look closer! We told him we have no clue, and then he asked us if it was right away when we first sat down to eat, or closer to the end. We tried to give him our best estimate of how long we were there, and how long after that I noticed it. He starts asking us, "So was it about 5, 10 minutes ago"? We tell him it was longer than that, and he tells us we literally told him about 5 or 10 minutes ago. NOT TRUE!! We never mentioned a time. He starts going back and forth with us, so we told him to ask our original server that we told so he could verify how long ago it was, but he (the manager) brushed that off and kept saying we told him less time. We explained that nothing was done by our original server other than him bringing out new sauce. We FINALLY got a hold of a different server, told him what happened, he apologized and said he would notify the manager, and NOW here we are talking to you 5 minutes later. He gives us this long spiel about how bugs come though open doors all the time and that it's possible the moth looking bug flew into my sauce after it was brought out to me. He says the moth was probably on it's last leg ready to die and happen to fall in my sauce. The sauce was right in front of me so I would have seen it moving around trying to escape!!! He tells us it's just something that happens, it's not their fault, and that there's nothing he can do, thanked us and walked away. He was very rude and cold!!! He spoke to us as if we were lying and trying to get out of paying for our meal which was not the case whatsoever!! We will NOT be returning to this location again!! If you like RUDE with service and EXTRA BUG protein in your sauce, this is the spot to go. If not, you may want to try a different location.

-JZM8G7RGN9sElKIZQ5P-w.text: This restaurant is very nice I really enjoyed it.we went on a Sunday afternoon and it wasn't crazy busy. We get sat and our server was Jade! She was awesome explained to us how the ordering worked and using the grill...now we started ordering alot we began with the gen flat iron steak was delicious! The shrimp was alittle difficult to deal with so we didn't really enjoy that so much but then we moved on to the pork belly and the red wine pork belly was amazing! The beef tongue was so tender and flavorful keep in mind they give you seasoning and sides and hot sauce to accompany all the meats! Then we ordered the KFC which was the Korean friend chicken wow mind blown delicious after the first one my table ordered 7 more!! When it comes to the food it was definitely to my liking the service was great!! I like that they change your grill out for you as often as you want so it keeps it from burning your meats!! Like I said everything was great!!! It was time to pay and my card for some reason wasn't working with the machine there and same came to my table and basically yelled out sorry your card was "Declined" super loud I was shocked for one cause my card works perfectly fine so I don't know but the way she came up and yelled it out embarrassed me in front of my friends! She could have come up to me alittle more quietly and told me but other than that it was great! I would definitely be recommending this place and I will be going back!!

9qncrz_8J8eSj8sEBU5UCA.text: Food and value is good. No free desserts included in the all you can eat and was ignored halfway through dinner because our servers shift had ended and no one had communicated with us, leaving us unattended. Staff seems unhappy, service and attitudes are lacking

GbnWcrqkZsnglZKqOtYa4g.text: To be quite honest with you all, I am not sure where to begin with this review of Gen Korean BBQ House, much like how the server had no idea when to begin refilling our water cups. It takes approximately 10 days without water for the average human to die of dehydration, which was clearly taken into account by this establishment as the all-you-can-eat-but-not-drink time limit was set to 2 hours. I must commend them for their forward thinking. It got so bad that at one point, myself and 8 other patrons were forced to participate in an in-house spelling bee contest in order to gain access to the coveted cup of water. We were asked to spell "rondayvoo," which apparently is not the correct was to spell rondayvoo. To the surprise of nobody, their thirst for literary excellence was not quenched.   There is much more to say, but I am writing this review with what is left of my withering energy. I can feel my senses numbing. I struggled to decide whether or not to contact my loved ones for the last time, or warn all future customers of Gen Korean BBQ House. My decision is obvious.  I farewell thee, and hope for a equally brighter, more hydrated future for our children. With that, I tip my glass (and a mandatory 18% gratuity) to the readers of this review, a final sip for us all, because that is all you are going to get.

LGyhxAR0MAeFmmnwtNoGtw.text: Finally we havr one the west side. Nice area nice ambiance.. as always.. one of my fave Korean bbq place!

qHBVDMPb5vImfObZVkiHSw.text: Wow!!!!! First time here already want to go back amazing service meats were fresh great atmosphere loved it

rq2ZLinMBsyJ2gJS0gHYNA.text: I brought my mom & dad for lunch on Mother's Day. We were on the waiting list about 11 parties ahead of us. It was good that we were able to monitor our status on the list through their website link. It did not take us long to get out table. The waiter assigned to us was very accommodating. He made some suggestions from the menu for us to try. I think his name was Jeremiah or something. It was my third visit but a first for my folks. Food was good & we had fun. Good job guys.

-hiZerf9g9OlzCXJvs5VeA.text: Oh I love this place. Come on all I bet whoever is reading this they probably were already a fan of Gen Korean BBQ in Henderson where the Galleria mall is located.  Well, this is like the feeling finally feels like the middle of town and a God send.  It was difficult to choose as Aloha Kitchen was just on the corner.  This is like old stomping grounds for lots of people including me.  Anyways, it was like accident for my girlfriend and me to find this place we had to U-turn to double check that our peepers did see "Gen Korean BBQ".  Ok, let's go and the parking lot was packed.  A host was there and we were sat quickly in a booth around 8pm on a Wednesday.  The low slung ceiling made the place a bit hotter inside which i loved.  The music was more of your popular music which was I thought easier to listen to the constant, loud rap music of the sunset location.  I think our server was Jomel but everyone was just awesome. For 20.00 the portions just kept coming.  My favorite is the Gen premium steak, beef bugolgi.  I can just eat that all day. The red wine pork belly was interestingly sweet. Mixed vegetables with mushrooms is good just don't burn it.  We had the hot plates changed probably twice.  I am getting hungry while typing a five star review of Gen Korean bbq. I have to go again.  Taking the girlfriend as she will be impressed but, it almost feel like a personal need to dine here.

POpoC4KhoGjMMcPl8mvOBw.text: I've always been a huge fan of Gen in Henderson.  The service is always excellent and fast, which if you've read my review of the Gen in Henderson, you'll know that's almost unheard of in any Korean restaurants.  This Gen on Sahara meets all my expectations and I am super happy that there's now not only one close to my house but one close to my office!  The meat is always decent, some much better than the others.  For example, the beef tongue.  No one I've introduced beef tongue to at Gen has ever disliked them.    The price is more than reasonable. Actually, it makes you wonder what kind of margin they are running at because it's just so much bang for your buck!    I don't see why I should try other Korean BBQ anymore because Gen has everything I want and need.  I highly recommend any locations of Gen.

vHbDiItpB6fG0EKb0rzhAQ.text: Wow! This place is unbelievable! My new favorite restaurant, HANDS DOWN! I went for the first time last week and I had to go back the next day. And I will be back this weekend! Although this yelp page is for the Sahara location, I went to the one in galleria mall. The meats are exceptional quality. I have never had Korean bbq that is so delicious! And you don't leave smelling like the place, which is a perk. Service but Shea was phenomenal. I definitely recommend this place!

xGYSux1JUEYgjMW4yE7jKA.text: Had a great lunch at Gens. The staff was very nice and came to our table multiple times. Kaithlyn was our server and she was so sweet and very attentive! Really great service and the food was of course delicious. Will definitely be back :)

cR7xdnEBHl1d6c6dYt-npw.text: I've been to a few ayce Korean bbq places and this is my favorite.  This place has the best ventilation among the ones i have been to and the service is fast and friendly.  The side dishes they have are pretty good and they also serve a salad.  They have rice if you want but if I'm doing ayce i don't want to get full on side stuff.  All of the meats are good so depending on what kind you like you really can't go wrong.  The sea food is alright for Korean  bbq i dont recommend getting it.  For dessert we got ice cream mochi it's not included with the ayce so it was a extra 3.50 for each.  We loved them definitely worth it.

IyrQn0HS1KOFp0FRzNsqiQ.text: Came here with a group of 8. Our server, Prince, had an attitude the entire time. One of our girls still had lipstick on her glass. Terrible service and dirty dishes!

kph6EkHXufhh5N-7LCqY9Q.text: So I was referred by a co-worker and decided to try this place on my bday.   Now before I get into my review...i need to let u know when my birthday is...yes...its on Valentine's Day!!   So normally I have to book one yr in advance at my favorite restaurants due to the fact that it's my birthday and Valentine's Day and normally it's hard to get a reservation...  But here I am one day prior to deciding to come check out this restaurant. I called at exactly 11 a.m and. a young lady answered the phone and politely took my reservations with no problems, no issues, no complaints.  Then the next day... they sent you a text message to confirm your reservation which I like so that's pretty cool..  So as my first time here ...the atmosphere is cool.. the bathrooms are clean but to me the tables were small.. You need space it's when you know what it is that you want to order... however the food was really good.. the flavor was good and even when you cooked it the meat was good..  For the menu and what you get I thought was pretty good so the only reason I gave four stars is because I wish there was a little bit more space for my dishes I don't like to rush when I eat...  All in all happy birthday to me I would come here again.

ll6uApqE22pLvNcGkruG1Q.text: This is one of my favorite all you can eat Korean BBQ place. It's a very nice setting and everyone is very friendly. The food is always great!

5lqF1XWmszTsMTIO1BaEfg.text: Our favorite KBBQ spot. Usually busy but you get seated fairly quick even with a large group of 6 or more. Food comes out quick as well! Waiters & waitress are always friendly & on top of it. Environment is loud & fun for any occasion!

e9Y1F4s2cuMh26YCy97T4g.text: Totally hip, spacious, and busy.  My first impression of this place, its packed! Came here on a Saturday night, and it was a pretty full house, fragrant with grilled meat that you will definitely leave smelling like your meal.  Love that they have drinks here! Soju galore! The soju capri is a fun choice if you're feeling adventurous. (Not included in AYCE)  They have appetizers like gyoza and jap-chae, veggies, and your typical side dishes.  Hostess failed to greet us, but the rest of the staff was friendly, attentive, gave reccomendations, and solicitated feedback. They were also very fast is bringing out what we ordered within a 5 minute timeframe. So good job there guys!   Now for the important stuff! The meat! Porkbelly dishes were thick, most of them weee pretty good with acceptable flavor. Except for the wine porkbelly. That was the most bland and dry/chewy piece of porkbelly I have ever eaten, also the purple color was a little off putting. Briskets and beef tongue were cut thin. We ordered a steak, or something along those lines, and it was huge! You definitely get some quality meat here, and they don't skimp at all.  They have seafood here as well! The squid/calamari was so tender and tasty! The octopus wasn't bad either, but it did look scary at first uncooked haha. Shrimp were not marinated, but a good option to start out your meal with(you peel off the shell yourself).  They have ice cream macarons here (not included in AYCE, so 3.50 each). Totally worth it if you love sweets! They have strawberry, green tea, coffee, and mango flavor.  The only thing I have to say is that I was incredibly thirsty after the meal. I'm usually a very hydrated person, but I was so parched and guzzling down water hours later. So that might be an indication of what they use to marinate thier meat/seafood with.  Overall good! I'll be back!

Bc74YDf7JMtJ86pv_iXiZw.text: Super bomb KBBQ.  Third time in & the service has been outstanding every time. Kalee kindly greeted & sat me as soon as I got in and was taken care of attentively by Alex & the rest of the  wait staff.   My go-to order:  1. Salad 2. Jap Chae 3. Cajun Shrimp X3 4. Bulgogi Beef X2 5. Hawaiian Steak  6. Brisket  Lunch time price is 16.99$ and for lunch, and considering all that I ordered that's definitely worth the price.  Noise level is medium, the place looks as new as it is, comfortable seats in the booth that are perfect for intimate dates & group of friends, lastly they play modern R&B & Hip Hop music so that's always a plus.   Everything tasted as perfect as usual.

p0qtOks8_2Xkvre_FTBhhw.text: Newish Korean BBQ joint trying to make it in this very transient of locations at Sahara and Decatur. Best thing about this place was the service... however the food was not very good.  Not horrible, but just ok.  The space is big... lots of cooktop tables.  That also means lots of smoke and grease in the air.  The owners need to turn up the exhaust fans or something.  They need better ventilation pronto. Plenty of meats and apps to choose from off the menu, but the quality of meat wasn't great.  Everything was too sweet... too much sauce or marinade... really mediocre cuts.   Not the worst, but many better choices for Korean BBQ.

ZCVgD9RRR4sRJUx-iGI2DA.text: The waitress, Jacel was amazing. Bless her heart she was working a busy side all afternoon but she was super friendly and helpful with picking some drinks and appetizers off the menu.  Definitely try her variation of the peach and mango Capri drink (if you are of age of course). My friends and I love to come here and will continue coming back for the food, service, and drinks. Haven't been to the happy hour just yet but will be back to do so. Our favorites from the meats are usually the beef tongue, brisket, and the Hawaiian steak. For the appetizers you have got to try their KFC and gyozas. They are really yummy and come out in a timely manner depending on high volume or low volume time. I love their fish cake and house salad personally because I like to save my appetite for the meat but feel free to ask their staff, they can usually help you try something you might like, and if not, well at least you can say you tried it. This place is great for small or large groups and has a beautiful interior with great lighting and music for a relaxing day or evening of food. Hope you love it as much as I do!!

bRpc2XPG7rVCAj9mG1JHqw.text: If I could give it zero stars I would because this place is a joke for customer service! I brought my son here for his birthday and we barely left the restaurant for 2 mins to the parking lot and my son forgot his birthday card at the table and when we went back no one helped! I even went in and spoke to who appears to be the manager and she was rude and unhelpful! I get it it's busy but this would only take a minute of your time and from the money we spent on this place was ridiculous to be treated like that. Also she did come to our table once when we were dining and we wanted to order more food and she didn't even wait for the next order instead she just took one order didn't say anything and left! They only want the money and they could care less about the customer dining experience!! NEVER AGAIN WILL I GO TO THIS PLACE!! Your not the only Korean bbq in town that's for sure!!

3ThqAtsvY3J4FlNoYH4hnA.text: So we went for dinner for the first time last night at the new location. My friend was able to get a table before we arrived so that was nice compared to the other location where they will not see you unless the entire party is there. And our server was very nice and once we ordered are Meats they came pretty quick. The only downside to our entire experience was they are always trying to take the plates and I like to keep one for the done meat so that was kind of irritating when they took the plate that I had the cooked meat for. We will definitely be going back as it is much closer than the other location!

unYKFOuNCrbWPuH4lqmcyQ.text: This location of Gen is in their soft opening phase right now. We went tonight and had a great experience. The service was incredible and the food was really good. Hopefully they can keep it up because it seemed like the service at the Henderson location could be hit or miss.  It's been a few months since we went to the Henderson location but there seemed to be a few differences between this location and the last time we went to the Henderson one. This Gen had two kinds of salt vs. just the green tea salt at Henderson. The galbi at this location also came bone-in whereas the galbi at Henderson was boneless. This location is less busy for now, but I'm sure it'll fill up as word gets out.  One negative about this location is that the ventilation isn't as good as the Henderson location, at least at our table. Other than that though, for sure a great experience overall and we're very happy to see Gen come to this part of town.

vpLPSdsF8WncPAkwatAhOA.text: Heard about it but a friend and was blown away awesome bbq Korean ... the pork belly was absolutely delicious

5IuFKwKLRKRf_6226CPFdA.text: Two different perspectives...  By my Korean standards, I would've give the food a 2.5. While you can't really go wrong on meat, it was ok. And then the japchae, soondubu and side dishes... meh. It mimicked the real thing, but tasted nothing like it was really supposed to.  By my normal standards... a 3.5. The portions were pretty small. My friends tried about just everything that was beef and chicken, and I would say to stick with the steak meats if you're looking for real korean bbq but the flavored meats weren't too bad.   service was amazing though. I loved the attention by the servers and our cups were rarely left empty long.   I've been to the gen in California and this is NOT what it was like. Which is why I think I'm more disappointed. Was hoping for a new bbq spot to go with friends but moving on.... So overall, ok. Will I go back... maybe.

X3iNOih0GvjnOF3NcFjYdw.text: Our usual place for Korean BBQ was jam packed so we decided to try some place new. We decided on Gen Korean BBQ House, my cousin had been to the one in CA, and recommended we try the Vegas location. Upon walking up we noticed how huge the size of the place was which was good! Lots of open space made for comfortable dining especially with KBBQ since it's always filled with smoky goodness. The place is super modern and "club like" blue lights, new decor, the music selection is great too! Made for a fun atmosphere! The service was terrific, our server was super efficient, friendly and helpful with suggestions on what to order. He also frequently changed our grill, which was great. The price for all you can eat was way decent for the quality and service we received. I believe it was $22 a person for dinner! The Bulgogi, Brisket, and short ribs were delicious! We will definitely be coming back!

NueFS0JZEj05jiTk3BJJOw.text: If you're short like the short ribs... then this place is for you! Pricing is based on how tall you are. If you're  under 40 inches... you eat free! 40-50 inches 9.99... and 50 inches + full price...  I'm in love with this Korean bbq place.. and I'm not only saying that because the hostesses here are 11/10 but because this place is well structured.  The moment you finally get seated.. your table is set up for you with multiple little condiments to dip your meat in. In addition, there is an order of house salad which goes well with the meats!  There are 36 different options you are able to order for 21.99 ALL YOU CAN EAT... and the ones with the thumbs up are chef recommended. The stars or asterisks indicate that they are spicy.  My personal favorites are the spicy pork belly, brisket, garlic chicken and short ribs.   Service is great too. If your hungry.. you're gonna thank them... they are as quick as this year going by

SPBQgI6TQE1WfgNhoqH9EA.text: I came here last night with some friends and had a good evening but wasn't blown away by the culinary experience. The best thing about Gen in my opinion is the service. I received my drink order and our first round of meats in literally less than a minute. We almost became overwhelmed with the amount of food piling up on our table. I do also like the interior here, and it's very spacious and modern chic.   As we cooked the meats over the stovetop grill, I felt that the meat was sticking to the grill much more than it should and it continued this way the whole night. Our grill actually became covered with charcoal and became unusable pretty quickly. However, the service helped us change out the stovetops promptly.   The complimentary appetizers were very standard, but I did personally like the salad. The best meat i had of the night was the premium steak and the pork belly since both of these were tender and flavorful. I really also enjoyed the tofu soup since it added some tanginess to break up the heavy savory dishes.   I did not enjoy the galbi one bit since it just tasted like sweet ambiguous meat. Most of the pieces I had were hard to chew through and very fatty. I couldn't even dip the meat in the dipping sauce to add some depth of flavor since the dipping sauce here consists of sesame oil and salt. The beef tongue was better, but it still lacked the succulent high grade quality of meat that I enjoy.   I understand that you get what you pay for. You can't expect the highest quality meat with a very affordable AYCE price. I am impressed at the large selection of meats and dishes and again I am very pleased with the great service we received here. I would come back here with a large group or for a big celebration, but I wouldn't come if i'm looking for an intimate date setting or gourmet meats.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wo2w1kFWzNCgSn3PmrkLPw.text: Pro Tip: Bring a change of clothes if you're planning on going out after eating.  I've now been to Gen 3 times.  I was reluctant to go that second time, because I did not have a good experience the first time around.  To my surprise, the menu had changed and the meat selection was definitely an upgrade.  And the best part is dinner is only $22!!!!!  You won't find another AYCE KBBQ place that serves kalbi for anywhere near $22!!!    Here my list of Gen's Greatest Hits:  Gen premium steak - oh so tender and juicy, might be my favorite item. kalbi - well marinated, tender, and very tasty.  cajun shrimp - i'm not sure what the cajun seasoning blend is, but i do  know it is delicious  spicy baby octopus - smothered in kochujang sauce, these ocotop.odes were scrumptious and not too spicy.  i highly recommend this item.  bulgogi - sliced thicker than what I prefer, the meat was a tough and put on my never order again list.  chadol - thinly sliced brisket that melts in your mouth. a must have item.  KFC - korean fried chicken was a bit disappointing.  tasted more like orange chicken from panda express than KFC from other korean joints.  japchae - this one is ok.  A bit on the sweeter side for my taste, but a descent appetizer choice.  gyoza - i admit, i love me some friend dumplings.  Especially when waiting on meats to cook, it is nice to have a cooked item to munch on.  soondoboo - thoroughly disappointed in this dish.  The broth was ok, pretty tasty actually, but they used the wrong tofu!!!!  You don't put firm tofu in soondoboo!!!!!!!!!!  Everyone knows that!!  You use the soft, silken tofu!!  Duh.  If the soondoboo and kfc were better, I'd give this place 5 stars.  As it stands, I can only do 4.  Also, I don't waste my time with pork or chicken.  I only go for beef and seafood.  For the price, service, atmosphere, and quality of food, Gen is no doubt my #1 choice for AYCE KBBQ place in Vegas.

8z-BRaITin6d9h7y-7rL-Q.text: I went here for the first time with my friend and it was AMAZING. The food was incredibly good, the sides were amazing and the amount of options were great. XU-pDpQvho7CMECpE32H5A.text: I love that they finally opened a Gen KBBQ House in Las Vegas! No more driving all the way to Henderson for Gen! This restaurant looks a lot bigger compared to the one in the galleria. Ambiance is the same -- very hip & modern while they play hip-hop/r&b in the background.   I've been here a couple of handful of times to finally write a review based on all of the different experiences I have had. Service can be spotty. I've had good and bad service -- it's not really consistent. It also depends on who you got. Some servers offer spectacular service compared to others. Last time my family and I were here (last Sunday), we had to ask for our radish paper three times before they finally gave it to us. Also, our seating area wasn't clean. There was a piece of japchae on my seat (ew..). Cleanliness is extremely important to me, especially if it's a place where you'll be eating.   Food quality also varies. I usually order lots of brisket (so good with radish paper, lettuce, garlic, & ssamjang), & often times it's delicious and melts in your mouth. However, it's not always consistent. There are times it was really rubbery -- & mind you, we did not overcook it. That would be my only complaint about the food, though. Most often than not, it's delicious. And my husband and I love coming here time and time again because the size of their booths are huge (we have twin babies & an 8 year old), plus their price is just right for how many items they have on their menu.   My person favorite food items here are their Hawaiian pork belly, brisket (chadol), wine pork belly, & bulgogi (hubby's favorite)!   Highly, highly recommend coming here to try it out for yourselves!

FKPsFVJ9jYOm7s9QV8qzrw.text: I had never been to a Gen Korean BBQ place before. My friend came from out of town and raved about it. It's a great place and f you're not n a Keto or Atkins diet. I love the variety of meat choices.

ZsOrObYCpamELAqWmQqpDA.text: UPDATE: We were so excited for Galbi that we decided to drive all the way to the Henderson location. We hauled our 4 kids (7, 5, 3 and 3m) all the way across town to eat. As soon as we got there, you can feel their welcome. Totally different atmosphere! Thankfully, we only waited about 10 minutes for them to get a booth ready. As soon as we sat down, ordered drinks and the first round of food. Food was cooked and in our kids bellies within 10 minutes from the time we sat down. Waiters and hostesses were amazing!!! Made sure our kids were ok with everything.   Crappiest service ever!!!! Every where you turn, there was an employee. I think there were more employees than there were guests. All those employees, and they still couldnt get our business. Three groups were seated before us. Ok, they were smaller groups. Fine. A party of 3 seated at a table that we could've fit on? Wait, why? Ok, whatever, maybe there's a better location for us. I ask the manager how much longer and they said they're getting the table ready right now. But then, a bigger group gets seated before us? And they came in after us? Wtf?! That's when they knew they f***ed up. You can see it in their faces. The hostess started talking on her headset and looked around and started typing on her iPad. Yup, we left. I wouldn't recommend anyone to go there until they figure out their flow. It's like no one knows what they're doing.

-g3wkizGEOhh7g3K5OJvyw.text: Gen is my favorite Korean BBQ! It's cheaper then most places for ayce! The meat has really good quality. At first it was hard to get the meat cooked just right but eventually you will learn. It's a great place to go! I crave it all the time!

Pf3h0OQHs_4hAbSwVo8jZg.text: I'll start with the good: For the most part Good service. They are fairly attentive. There were several instances that we had to remind them to bring us something we had asked for.    They are very generous with the portions and keep bringing out more and more meat.    I had never been here before so it would have been good for them to tell you how the place works.   The vents above us didn't seem to work well. There was a draft in the restaurant pushing smoke from the table next to us directly to us.   I wasn't impressed with the variety or quality of the meat. The marinades were too mild and most of the meat to fatty for my likings.   Very limited non meat options.  The KFC came out ice cold. We had to ask for a second order that was warm. Not room temp cold but refrigerator cold.   The place was poorly ventilated and too loud. The music was too loud and made it difficult to talk. Your clothes will smell like the poorly ventilated restaurant.   A lot of people obviously love this place. I don't think it's for me.

kzpu4qdOjRHQMRM02Glhig.text: Came here on Sunday and you need to come early. I been to the location by Galleria  mall. It was good at that location but this location is way better. I brought my family and we had a party of 8 and everyone I mean everyone is awesome that work there. They are so nice and attentive. Even did things I didn't expect.. L6H5GPYRPgM5Dl6ZuJZMuQ.text: Food was great, alot of selection to choose from. Our server was very helpful, being our first time trying this place. We will definitely return

RxPD0jU-wSKvK4P69K2_LQ.text: In Vegas for a week and had to get some Korean bbq. The reviews were pointing to Gen with a lunch deal for $16.99 so we head on over. In short This is a fantastic Korean bbq restaurant!  The ambiance was very lounge like with blue neon lights reflecting off of mosaic mirrored vases. The standard  Korean bbq set up with the round grill in the center of the table where you prepare your own foods was surrounded by salts sauces Kim chi, & ginger and was presented on lovely simple white saucers and plates. The menu was AYCE top quality beef, seafood, chicken and pork. The bulgogi  was so good we ate four servings of it! Not to say the servings were small they were adequate and replaced almost immediately with more by quick service! We also tried or shall I say devoured, shrimp, premium pork belly, garlic pork belly, KFC (Korean fried chicken which is prepared in the kitchen) calamari, beef brisket, Hawaiian beef steak, & gyoza. Last but certainly not least is service! All that food  was served quickly with a smile by Justin and assists. We were gratefully full and ordered the icecream macaroon sandies to go we feel so stuffed we are going now To "walk it off!!"

24xIvptWMpxEhN-_nhRpWw.text: Went to Gen for a late lunch /early dinner. Was very impressed with the large selection of  meats, pork and chicken as well as the portions. The price is very reasonable dinner,  $21.99. Loved  the steak supreme, spicy bulgogi and the  the brisket. You also get various side dishes. Overall a great dinning experience.

QbdV2zD52Bg6jQ6tVJdarQ.text: I wanted to go check out this Gen BBQ in Las Vegas since I've been to the Gen BBQ in Cerritos, CA. That location had excellent food and service. I came with a group of 8 and we waited for about 30 minutes on a Saturday night, which was fine since it's the weekend. When we sat down, there is a 2 hour limit. First, we weren't greeted by the hostess and one of them had an attitude and just didn't seem friendly or want to engage with customers. We sat at our table and our server was also not too friendly and didn't seemed like he was too happy serving us. I understand it's a Saturday night, the restaurant gets busy, but don't show that attitude at the table, especially when most of my friends work in the food and beverage industry. There was an issue with my friend's daughter (she's a kid); she's vegetarian and only wanted salad and corn and the server wanted to charge her full price of all you can eat just for eating a salad and corn. Instead of explaining that she can just pay the a la carte, he straight up told my friend that she still had to pay full price. Eventually, she asked for a manager and they sorted that issue. The food was delicious, I ordered the beef bulgogi, Hawaiian steak, iron steak. The service was slow; I had to ask 2-3 times to get extra tongs and forks for our table. Our table didn't really get checked up much and it was frustrating. One server or busser name Elden and another server at the end helped us and was really attentive and helpful. I appreciated that. That's how service should be. Overall, the food was good but they lack service and the hostess should probably change their attitude if they are the first contact as a customer walk in the restaurant and seated to start their dining experience. I will not come back to this Gen BBQ.

v9qz2p5yH0YYAU2v0NsiFg.text: perfect , the food is great the server is nice and overall the service is A+. I would recommend to my friends, oh and the place is clean

dMxNeYHukBUkcryrUBv0Hg.text: Always great service and food. Great place for kids as well. My 4 and 5 year olds love going. They have a great variety of menu options for lunch and dinner. This is by far my favorite Korean Restaurant to eat at in Las Vegas.

kh6zkF9CiGsYji8z96RqTA.text: Went here when pretty hungry. I've been to 5 other KBBQ joints in town... and this place is average. Good meat selection, but a lot is frozen. Prompt service. If you're close by or have a time crunch, it's worth going. Otherwise, drive a bit further for meat that isn't frozen and/or opt for premium wagyu cuts.

z_aUHB9DSLOKhBL_lCulVQ.text: This is our second time to eat at Gen, the first one was at Fullerton. (The food was heavenly) So when we are at LV we looked for Gen. They never failed to amaze us on how delicious and fresh their food. I highly recommend their Gen Premuim Steak, Hawaiian Pork Belly and Spicy Pork Bulgogi all of these are very tasty and tender. The mashed potato (one of my favorite) green salad, pickled raddish and kimchi are so so good. Also try their fresh seafoods like cajun calamari and garlic shrimp. About their services, they are very fast on giving what you need, they will give you 4 different item and then after that you can order again. We tried their mouthwatering macaron ice cream and it taste good.

fO1C7vJHcQ8PksBUSt7Kfg.text: I just have to give 5 Stars to this all you can eat Korean BBQ. First we have been here at least 1 time a week. Everytime is such a pleasure and the mood and staff are GREAT! But I am serious about this and the food is very good and the price is right. You get so much for your money here. For those that have been here knows exactly what I say is True. Honestly, my wife and I enjoy this place alot. It's all you can eat and they are so helpful and friendly. Unlike our horrible time at 8oz. On my wife's Birthday. 8oz doesn't come close to this place. The mood at Gen is nice and cozy. The booths are soft and very comfortable, and the music is just loud enough to enjoy and not have to talk over it. We highly --- And I do speak highly of this place. We will again be going on Friday and believe it or not. We can't wait to enjoy their short ribs.  Thank you Gen for giving our city a nice place to eat at a great price.

vyPwWK6YhTvFJoThcPVM3w.text: This is the best AYCE Korean BBQ in Vegas.  Their smoked garlic pork belly tastes awesome!  Their meats are fresh and their service is great.  The atmosphere is very hip and cozy as well especially the booth seating.  Really highly recommend this place.

VKnJSH2_0Oupy2GFP-IX6A.text: Great service. Affordable price. Nice ambience and lots of parking space. Will definitely come back.

YcFhZAgici4m3bCg8X2Cjw.text: My first Yelp review ever. Originally went to another yakiniku type restaurant on Spring Mountain but their wait was ridiculously long so was frantically searching in Yelp for somewhere to.eat with my Hangry family. I then looked up Gen on Yelp to see how far the one in Henderson was then remembered seeing a Gen restaurant on Sahara every Sunday as we pass by it after church. I checked on Yelp and low amd behold there were already 7 reviews. I then made a quick phone call to ask how long the wait was. The friendly girl over the phone said at the moment there was no wait so we went ahead and made our way over. And now my review begins: -Upon entering we were greeted with such a warm and kind welcoming by a lovely girl and three guys. Before we even walked through the doors we could see the excitement in their attitudes that patrons were coming in. Right before we got seated all of the front of house employees in the restaurant yelled out "Irashaimase" pardon my rustiness on my spelling. -The second we were seated Anthony was there ready to take our orders and literally within a couple of minutes our food and drinks arrived. As dinner progressed I noticed how attentive and consistent they were. Another thing I noticed is that it got crazy busy. -Despite the craziness in the restaurant, every single worker remained enthusiastic and happy to be working there. I believe the owner was there that night waiting on the patrons happily and making sure every single guest was satisfied. The manager even came by to change our grill and wait on us. -The food was 10 stars out of 5. It was absolutely and Incredibly yummy. -The restaurant was clean and so were the restrooms. I definitely don't see this place end up on dirty dining...and I am a stickler for cleanliness. It's so awesome that we don't have to drive a 30 minute drive to the Gen in Henderson. We will definitely be coming back and recommending this location to others.

RQHQxhwyPHNvkScqSwj5nQ.text: Food was great, prices are great, atmosphere is excellent, decor , the ONLY thing missing is rice paper and it would be absolutely PERFECT.

W8GgMz1Aba9yEaEmGCj3Tg.text: Best Korean BBQ hands down. A must go to when in vegas. Customer service is over the top. Good service and good food can't get any better!

C1_JjWrKUICHNWFC8L6r2A.text: So when we heard about the new location on the West side we were happy and eager to visit.  What a letdown. The thing we noticed right away was that the ventilation, it was either working poorly or nonexistent.  Smoke was so bad that it made us think twice about staying. But we wanted to give this location a chance. So we sat down and ordered. I really have to say, the serivce was on point. Grill was always changed and our tea was always refilled, the server was really attentive. The food on the other hand, different story. One item we always order is the Galbi. Too plain. it was not marinated at all. It tasted like someone just dipped it in sauce and brought it out.  Very disappointed! We would love to order more and enjoy the ambiance but the smoke was too much so I just wanted to hurry up and eat and get out. I truly hope Corporate/Management takes this seriously.  My wife and I visit Gen in Henderson at least twice a month and we love this place and we want to come back.

kD9Qq6znRWEChqvNOHli1A.text: After the first order, the 7-8 waiters basically ignored a group of 9 people sitting basically in the middle of restaurant. Isn't that amazing? The better part is that basically all our waters were empty and we had people glance over, but didn't even acknowledge our existence. It took 20 minutes for us to even get the check after we finished eating, all clearly waiting for a single waiter to ask if we wanted the check. Simply. Amazing. Forced gratuity for service that wasn't present is psychologically mind breaking.

So4KxqQSCYuYP-wb2gL80w.text: This is my favorite Korean Barbecue house ever. Great service and great Food especially their beef bulgogi.

3UPPTrXMgdZySV-OCWp0FQ.text: The meet is so not fresh. As soon as it touches the meet separates. Meets have excessive fat. Chicken was bad that it tasted sour. The restaurant has a lot of room for improvement.

m6Qwfh15au8qTSsmVz5N0w.text: This place is great! Plenty a choices for low carb or Keto dieters too. $22 all you can eat? Amazing! And the food quality is fantastic. The service is so fast you're practically eating as soon as you sit down. Can't beat it. Highest recommendation!

wCZJpKYXCtQXaSuo48x77g.text: Went the Gen KBBQ house for the first time just a few hours ago and it was AMAZING. Great food. Great customer service. The servers/bussers were on top of it from making sure we were okay to refills and didn't bother as much as most servers in restaurants do! We'll definitely be back!!

OtlojcWRMrh3f5yk0wugTg.text: Great Restaurant, nice staff awesome atmosphere. Austin is an awesome server. Me and my boyfriend come here often and he always served us up and has a great attitude and great personality

muNPTViw0i9xzZpXU7d0QQ.text: I came to eat here on Saturday and it was amazing! Their Customer service is perfection! I haven't had good customer service in a while and the food was fresh and delicious! We didn't even have to wait for our drinks or refills they checked on us many times and we never missed anything at our table! They were very friendly and let us take our time eating! Thank you Gen! I will be back this weekend!!!!

U22ypI1Ai0jNoR42PuWT0g.text: This place was phenomenal! My boyfriend and I went on a date last night and decided to try a new place. One of his friends recommended the place, and I'm so glad they did. We went around 8 o'clock without reservations and we were seated within minutes which was extremely nice. We loved the decor and how spacious the whole place was. We got seated into a booth which was very roomy, which I personally loved. All the food fit perfectly onto the table and we ordered a decent amount. The service was astounding! As soon as we got seated our server acknowledged us and told us he would be with us shortly. Even after he walked away someone else stepped right in to make sure we would get drinks quickly. Our server returned no later than 2 minutes and recommended some great meats to try. Our favorites were the Hawaiian pork belly, spicy baby octopus, and the garlic calamari. One of the biggest things for me when going out to eat is having the water glass continuously filled, and our server made sure that it was always filled and that it never reached the bottom. We were always checked up on, made sure our empty plates were taken away almost instantly, and always had the grill tops changed. This place was all around spectacular from the moment we walked in to the moment we left. This place is a definite favorite now and we will DEFINITELY be returning!

vYSuEXoro0TGgU21MGa-KA.text: One of the best K BBQ spots in town. Fun atmosphere, prices are decent, and tons of food. Will definitely be coming back.

jwVu7yEKgLnpubJSfT-8ZA.text: Great food  great atmosphere. Honestly had a really great time our server Austin was AMAZING! Very attentive suggested great items on the menu and encouraged us to try new amazing drinks! Defenitly coming back to this location and asking for Austin! Make sure you ask for him you won't regret your time here we defenitly didnt!

Wje2U130yTIsBD5pxgVbZw.text: very fast service and cheap lunch! there was no dessert on the menu but they have macaroons for sale in the front of the restaurant.

eFYDMFJJAUPK0zbeleZCDw.text: So happy for them opening one down the street from my house! The atmosphere is amazing and appreciate all the workers here. They are very nice and attentive to you while your eating. I love the choice in music that brings me back to my middle school days. I wish they had the rice paper wraps like in California so hopefully they add it.

PQmf4-2Zo6S00YGLcDREEg.text: The food is incredibly delicious and the pricing structure is really awesome. But you will leave smelling like you've been working in a kitchen over a hot griddle so do not wear anything that requires dry cleaning or that you don't intend on washing or leaving outside your house.

5Jxo42tmjNfcIJkfjI7ekg.text: I went here for a friend's birthday, and it was great. Food was wonderful, the service was fast and the food kept coming.  I decided to take my girlfriend there for her birthday, because she liked it so much, and was told they wouldn't take reservations. Ok, so I called the night of and asked how long the wait would be.  20 to 30 minutes, seamed like a reasonable wait for a Friday night, so we head over. We arrive only to find groups of people hanging around the entrance. We go to put our names in, and the hostess said 2 hours at least. I tell her I just called and they said 20 to 30, and she tells me "that's just what we're telling people on the phone."  As much as I like the food, I'm not sure it's worth dealing with people who'll jerk you around on a special night.

tIIoxi0A6UlTj_NQrfla4g.text: Austin is the Best!!! He was on top of things. Very prompt and attentive.  Food was was awesome!! Definitely would come back again

7fPFJKLMOoQ6fxs5DZLr-w.text: Amazing service. Kenny and his team were very attentive. Food was great. Flat iron steak and beef bulgogi were my favorites. Will definitely go again.

fXdkh3pu6MgijuxeJ66gUQ.text: Best Korean BBQ place I've been to in Las Vegas. The service at this store was incredible. The meat was out within a couple minutes, waters were constantly filled, and our waiter Austin was extremely friendly. We will definitely come back to this location!

3MihNwKElK9l49uekoE0tA.text: great customer service. they were really quick with the delivery of all things from drinks, ban chan, meat and other side orders. not too pricey, and didn't have to wait long to get seated. (only 2 people) might take longer for bigger groups, but overall I really liked it, and would defintely come back again and recommend it.

9l_CnEVHI-ve4eKVKVVT9Q.text: Amazing! Great fun club-like atmosphere! Awesome music. Best KBBQ ever! Tastes sooooo good! I want it right now just thinking about it! Definitely going back for the pork belly!!!!

fMkcEAQJ_pHk6yyinwgJ0w.text: Our visit to Gen started off very well.  We were seated right away and had an amazing waiter with a great personality.  We came during happy hour and he said we would be charged the happy hour price for drinks.  Unfortunately he left without any notice and it was hard to get service after our initial order.  When we finally waved down somebody they were a little rude and acted like we were an inconvenience for trying to order more food.  We ordered more drinks about fifty minutes before happy hour ended as well.  When we got the check only our first two drinks had the happy hour price.  I would have gladly given this place five stars had we had our first waiter the whole time.  Our waitress just seemed unconcerned and stingy after he left.  She was also kind of rude when she brought our second round of drinks because she almost tossed the glasses and straws on the table.  I teach first grade and deal with rude children all day long, and I expect to be treated better when spending 100 dollars on dinner.

5ASfY9y43bsAULbZSeue2A.text: We went here with my hubby and friends today. I would say that this is the best All you can eat Korean Bbq I ever tried so far. We ordered beef brisket, beef belly and premium steak. The meat and side dishes tastes really good. Not to mention that kimchi and veggie salad are my favorites. I will surely keep coming back to this place.

eLt-1C-iUMUr9GSz_rv1jQ.text: This place has a really nice atmosphere and modern design. The food here is really good and it's all you can eat for just a little over $20 per person. I've had other Korean BBQ in town but this place seems to be the best value for the money.

JI4edPXni-NaEggdHlcrOQ.text: Where do I begin, we are frequent flyers here at gen. We normally come on weekends and parties of 4 or more .. tonight was a special occasion as it was the night my girlfriend graduated from college... we got Denise , she was polite the first second we sat down, but we weren't sure of what to order and she seemed to get agitated... we then ordered, even repeated what we wanted.    So out came the food... we only got the food one half of the table ordered and double of one item we ordered and had to eat that because we didn't want to waste.   We ordered a soju carafe(mango), and a Capri drink (pomegranate) The Capri was supposed to be pomegranate.. but it came out in a carafe... I tried to explain it to the person who brought it out but she was confused, so when Denise came back, we explained it to her and she said OK! I got it, she comes to the table with a Capri soju when it should have been a carafe!  I asked 3x for gen sauce, we got one water out of 4 ordered, then when we asked for 3 we got 4... we had to re order some items because it never came.  Quality of the food didn't seem the same either....Such a crappy experience especially when it was to celebrate a big accomplishment.    And no, the place was not busy at all. Truly sucks,  I hope the place isn't going downhill. We always hype the place up to our friends. Not sure when we will return

XUIoG17snkmLE-4Kj2j8dA.text: We visited a few weeks ago. My spouse, myself and our 7 year old. When we were going to be seated they checked my sons height and confirmed that he would be half price. They measured him 2 times. Same price for him every time we go. Cool. We have a meal. Service from our serve and food was good as usual.   When we went to close our check we were charged for 3 full priced meals. We mentioned it to our server and he went to go fix it. He tells us the front told him our son was full price. A few minutes pass and one of the ladies from the front..maybe the supervisor comes over. She was rude first off. We explained to her that we were told when we first checked in that our son was half price. She kept saying we had to go and remeasure our son. Keep in mind we were sitting in the back by the restrooms. It was the weekend so trays and people everywhere. At that moment when she kept insisting we get back up to have him measured for the 3rd time We got irritated. As I went to get up to take my son up there she said never mind and that he was half price.   And then to add..with it being a super busy weekend and the commotion of everything. A full tray was spilled all over my guys shoes. Food and liquid went all over and some came on the table. We got an "oops". Things happen I know, but with the way the night was going it just added to the frustration.   All in all we ended up being charged correctly and everything was ok. Just the whole situation and how it was handled was pretty irritated. We would frequent pretty often. We haven't been back since.   :/

ge3QU9ni_QlcBXDExgXJQg.text: Terrible customer service and the first round of meat got burnt because the waitor set the flame too high. Not going back there again...

HbEjsl0ABoIxOFZ26euupw.text: I loved this place!!!! Great food, experience, and value! I will go there again and again!  The service was great too. An excellent place to bring guests visiting from out of town.

t__83VvTljoOQY7zIPMqSg.text: I specifically wanted to go to Gen to celebrate my birthday with my family, and picked this location because it's usually less crowded than their Henderson location.  What a mistake, there's a reason why this location is less crowded, the customer service was terrible!  Ordered 2 drinks and got charged for 3 because our 22 month old child was sipping out of my wife's cup.  Instead of having him cry, out of convenience she asked for another cup since refills are supposedly free.  But we got charged an extra drink over 1/4 cup of soda.  The manager even sided with the server.   Even though kids under 40" eat for free apparently they are charged full price for drinks!!  Fortunately there are plenty of good Korean bbqs in town, I will not be wasting my time and money on this one again!!!

2sugEJtD4rx9d9Fvvomi0Q.text: You can't beat the price for this place. All you can eat with over 30 different choices. I recommend getting half orders of items, that way you can try more not get full. The servers are pretty good and running around to get you side dishes and change out the grills.

wF9ytmi0iFaU3OpMrkzfZQ.text: Very nice atmosphere and very spacious. If you love to have Korean bbq and like to cook while chatting with friends and family, Gen is a nice place to go, lots of selections to choose from. Love the baby octopus, milk guts and pork belly and of course the endless side dishes it comes with.

7V12hoWVaKlzWK5CIVBsuA.text: Great service and food.  Everything is clean and fresh, servers are all around to help and bring what ever you need.

23jqvrA8Ppq92jWdic-x9A.text: For the price it is very good way better than hwarro I believed.  I have been back many time since this review. Money well spent. The only  reason  I didn't give it a 5 star was due to the lack of free icecream  desserts

rP4Zkmn8XyDeM-bS7bri3w.text: Best service and great BBQ!  Seriously my favorite Korean BBQ place right now.   Some of the best service I have ever had. Staff is ultra friendly, service is super fast.   And to top it all off, the menu has so many options (some I have never even seen or had before) and is at a price lower than most other all you can eat Korean BBQ places of the same/lower quality.   Everything was fresh, great marinades, lots of options. Just overall delicious and so worth it.   Definitely recommend that you try it out!

b8HBvJPs7p2jiuh6G9m1QQ.text: This is our second time visiting Gen korean BBQ house, however at a different location. The atmosphere is the same as other locations, good vibes, good music in the background. Our service was very friendly and attentive. The food is great, but it seems like its not too much of a high quality meat but then again it is an all you can eat spot. I would definitely dine here again because im an extreme meat eater and who is to pass up a good deal on all you can eat?

pHQimPd87CdPGFNN9aJi5A.text: I loved this place! The atmosphere was really modern and they had good music on which made a good vibe. I went to lunch with one of my friends on a Saturday and the food was amazing!! I've never been to a place where you cool the food yourself but it made it really fun. The grill sits in the center of the table and you order different types of meat and grill it up. Though everything was tasty I think my favorite was the Hawaiian steak and the garlic chicken. The garlic chicken comes with a cheese dip but it's a low profile flavor so it doesn't overwhelm the meat. It's not just meat though on the side we had edamame, kimchi, cole slaw, mashed potatoes. And they serve lots of different sauces, salt and pepper, and a green tea salt and pepper to give a variety of flavors. Our server happy was so patient and kind and answered all of our questions along with impeccable service. We finished up with complimentary ice cream from the GM (who was also extremely nice and helpful). As if amazing food and service wasn't enough the prices are so reasonable and it's all you can eat!! Try it for a date night, with a group of friends, or just to catch up with a friend like I did...you won't be disappointed!

AYTAw9qDIdJcZE43hY8kuQ.text: Nothing close to the Gen in Chino. Poor quality meat, subpar service, and inflated prices.

QrwqPxvJOkV3Zu9c6H-VYQ.text: Lovely dining experience. So many options to choose from there is something for everyone kids and adults alike. They constantly changed out the trays so our food never tasted burnt.

I54HwgnpjTEHBLzlXIUn_Q.text: So I didn't even get to enjoy my dinner with my friends and family because the service here was horrible. The host pops an attitude to my cousin who just asked not to be seated yet because not all of our party was there yet. Then our server who's name was #prince by the way who kept giving my sister an attitude because she went to ask to speak to a manager because he won't stop with the eye rolling or slamming plates down or even when she just ask if the corn can be charged separately from the all you can eat price. Because my niece doesn't eat meat. Mind you everyone at our table are all managers in the food and beverage industry. Even us as managers understand it's a Saturday night, it gets busy we understand. The only people who was nice and gave us good service was the busy boys and the other server #jan. I visited the Cerritos, California location and I got really great service on a busy Friday night. I won't be coming back to this location ever again.

qIETqaO12SlVbehLvfDgjw.text: Amazing! We loved the sides and the galbi was delicious. Highly recommend. Price is very reasonably $22 per person. Service was the best I've ever had at an ayce Korean bbq place.

_enpV7yPWezECednTE4QYA.text: Went for lunch ($16.99) today around 2pm. It wasn't busy and we only waited less than 5mins in the line and waited another few mins for the foods to come out. Staff are friendly and accommodating. They let you know everything you need to know if its your first time in Gen's (stuff like; not allowing discovery card, a 2 hour time limit, and charge of $5 if you did not finished everything you ordered...etc). **They do not allow unfinished foods for take outs since it is a All-You-Can-Eat Restaurant.  NOTE: foods quantity are given in small portion but nothing to worry about, you can just reorder until your tummy is satisfied.   RECOMMENDATION: Grab a Macaroon Ice Cream before you go. Its not part of AYCE though, but $3.50 is worth it.

sPXAWpNhg3HlY5B4QoTsVg.text: The service and the food was great! Definitely worth the price just a little loud you can't really hear if you are talking to someone but it was an amazing experience definitely a new favorite

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They have a variety of choices very good service definitely enjoyed our food and the price is really worth it definitely a new favorite

Mm8hu97Wc2p_uJdoqVgXFg.text: This place was amazing. The quality of food was better than any kbbq I've ever been to. The service, however, was even beyond that. The team works as a team and the food and drinks come much faster than expected. Everyone is working seems very happy and extremely friendly, they attend to your every need. Garzee was our server today and he had extremely helpful recommendations and checked on us constantly and attended to everything :) will be coming back again!

iS05YRqEhXPSV0SQ0BTILg.text: We're very familiar with Gen Korean BBQ from our frequent trips to So. California so it came as a surprise that the branch on Sahara was very lacking in terms of service. We had meats being delivered and then sitting idly uncooked while we constantly kept requesting our grills to be fired up. Then the rice orders along with several other menu orders never showed up if it weren't for our constant nagging and subtle reminders. I mean, it's somewhat understandable that dropping in as a large group at 8:30 pm means the staff is probably dead tired and catering to our needs is probably the last thing on their minds--I get that. But is it too much to ask for proper service as good paying customers? Heck most of the sides we requested for were out, how could an AYCE KBBQ joint run out of potato salad--on the first round?!? Don't even get me started on hunting down our server for soda refills. Good thing the meat quality was okay and the staff, despite the subpar service are polite and apologetic about the inexplicably long delays--I'd never ding them for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly, beef belly and more meat...

ExVGgYgbHtwFcMR1dBl3aQ.text: I took the family here for late night dinner instead of the usual buffet. We all agreed that this was the right choice since there was no preparation, cooking or clean up. We also made sure not too dress too nicely since we knew we would be smelling like BBQ after all the table cooking we would have to do.  We arrived late 9ish thinking that Gen would be crowded like it normally is, but we were surprised that the place was not even half full. We still had to wait for almost 10 minutes since there was not enough servers. The queue behind us continued to grow but it was not until once the manager showed up and let us know we will only have until 45 minutes left to sit & eat and we told him we only 30 minutes. We were asked to seat then the clock was set. I guess they were closing early.  However, once we got seated we quickly made our choices but still had to wait for our waiter as he was still servicing his other tables. The policy of ordering the meats is only four meat dishes ordered at each round and you cannot order more than one of the same dishes. For the non-meat dishes, you can order at the same time as the meat without limits.  Together we finished off 18 orders of meats and seafood. Most of the pork and beef orders came out in roughly 2 strips each, calamari were one rectangle, shrimp was only five each time and the bulgogi came in a bowl. Overall the best dishes were the cajun pork belly, head on shrimp, Kalbi and the all pork belly varieties. We were bummed that they ran out of tongue. Overall the meats were easy to cook and the controls for the gas grill easy to modify at the end of the table.  The veggie plate was a joke with cuts of bell peppers, onions, zucchini and slices of corn on the cob. The japchae noodles were disappointing with the portion size and lack of meat. The tastiest non-meat dish was the fried dukboki with a sweet and sour sauce.   Service was efficient and each time the meat dishes were delivered the waiter took our next round of meat orders. The pace was slow initially but picked up once we got into the routine of cooking and eating.  Definitely worth a return visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front Reception Desk

VN40yStgEdDyXK_BV_O0Ng.text: I have visited the Los Angeles location of Gen Korea BBQ several times and I love it! So I decided to try the Las Vegas one and what positive surprise!  The menu is a bit different, same price though ($21.99). It does not have calamari steak but it does have small garlic marinated calamari. Gyozas, KFC Chicken (Orange chicken) and assorted vegetables - you could order all of one of them in my case mushrooms!   We went at an off time, which meant that they weren't that busy and the service was perfect. Quick, efficient, caring and helpful!  I honestly think I liked this location better.  I will be back soon! Cheers!!

NL2ZtB8mtbUiVYe2oDl2hA.text: THIS PLACE IS LITERALLY THE BEST KOREAN BBQ! My cousin invited me and my brother to try this All-You-Can-Eat Korean restaurant name Gen at Sahara and Decatur.   When we got in, the place was packed. There was even a waiting list. We waited about 5 to 10 minutes which wasn't bad. As we went in, the dining area was upscale and up to date, more of a night club scenery. As for the food, it was very delicious! We ordered many dishes and cooked the way we wanted. And mmm...SO GOOD! They put the flavor to perfection. I recommend eating here, not just because it's new, but the food is to die for!  We ordered: -

ZrNiofPm_kMYtCE_47JFcw.text: Got treated like a KING by my fam at Gen Korean BBQ House on Father's Day!  After talking about it for months we finally paid a visit to Gen.  But...yeah, it was super busy for lunch on Father's Day!  No worries though, we still only waited 15 minutes or so for a table.  Is it just me, or is Gen reminiscent of some kind of dance club with lots of neon?  I personally found it very inviting - tables and seats were clean, the high ceilings helped to dissipate the endless amount of smoke coming from tables, heck - even the AC was ON!!  Some of these K-BBQ places...they let you burn while cooking your own food!  Gen was a nice change, comfortable manning the grill.  For the menu that day, since it was a holiday Gen was doing dinner menu all day.  But DAMN - their AYCE pricing is pretty on point!  $21.99 per person?  That's like a good $5-6 less than the competition!  They may not have the biggest AYCE menu compared to others, but you know me...I love a great deal!  Cheap is fine with me!  Apps included too!  Even with a tinier menu, the fam & I ate a ton of food:  *Gen Premium Steak (we had like 6 orders of this LOL) *Gen Beef Belly *Gen Beef Bulgogi *Gen Flat Iron Steak *Beef Tongue (seriously we ordered a TON of this, so melty) *Premium Pork Belly *Red Wine Pork Belly *Gobchang (yummy intestines) *Cheese Pork Cutlet (so tasty!) *Jap Chae (nice addition) *Crispy Cajun Chicken (spicy good) *K.F.C. (Korean Fried Chicken) *Soondoboo (spicy tofu stew) *Assorted banchan (with extra helpings of kim chee!)  A TON of food!  Really!  Don't even worry about the 2 hour time limit, we were near stuffed after like 50 minutes!  The quality of the meats were not like the fancy non-AYCE K-BBQ places, but none of us seemed to mind while we savored every bite.  The beef tongue was a favorite of the table too - the only issue we had is that only 4 thin slices come to your table per order.  We had to keep asking them to bring at least 4 orders (16 slices) to our table each time.  The Gen Premium Steak is a like cut of ribeye I believe, so it was rich everytime.  Delicious!  The apps were pretty good, our favorites were the Cheese Pork Cutlet (we ordered 2) and the Crispy Cajun Chicken.  Each person is allowed rice as well, but don't forget to ask!  Otherwise your meal will go rice-less.  Tip - if you like spicy, ask for a bowl of the Gen Special Sauce!  It's some kind of in-house made dipping sauce for their meats made with lots of garlic & jalapenos.  So good with their K-BBQ!  One thing I did notice with Gen is that you don't get a dessert to end your meal like other AYCE K-BBQ places do.  But I did not miss it one bit.  I believe I finished my meal with some Soondoboo and a side of intestines, HA!  Certainly was a great end to my Father's Day lunch!  For the value & variety of Gen Korean BBQ, I can easily say our fam will be back for another visit.  Mother's Day?  Birthday?  Probably almost any day!  GEONBAE!!

InytIR8Cj16pmbrLo4G_tw.text: This was my first time eating at a Korean BBQ, where I need to cook my own meat. 6fenIPBB5iF8rYFQyRzn4g.text: The newest Gen Korean BBQ house is doing things right, I'm a fan..=)  Gen Service:  Great great service to get our party of 10 seated within 10 minutes on a Friday evening.  Our meats were brought to us quickly upon ordering and banchan replenishes were quick as well.  Our lead server was great with changing the grill and keeping everyone's drinks fresh.  All the staff in general had a upbeat and positive attitude, fantastic.  Gen BBQ: Everything we ordered was above average but the premium steak, bulgogi and pork stood out for so these received repeat orders.  The salad was really fresh and paired well with our meats.  The usual banchan side dishes were good but the servings were tiny.  I especially enjoyed their Jap chae noodles.  Ask your server create the Gen Dipping Sauce as it doesn't automatically come with your orders.  This is a delicious in house dipping sauce that I will request at future visits.  Gen Ambiance:  A large dining area smartly designed with multiple tables, booths to accommodate large crowds that are popular with ayce Korean BBQ.  The open room restaurant dimly lit with some great Tron blue accent lighting but you're eating area is well lit for dining.  At an initial glance, you could mistake this place as a high end cocktail lounge.  I frequent the Gen House in Green Valley which I enjoy and they're doing well with their newest location.  This is another great option in this great foodie city of Las Vegas and I'm sure i'll be back.  See you under the blue lights! =)

8cNbcK0JQb_kVlA4ZeU6uQ.text: The best places are found spur of the moment.  My wife and I have been on a personal trek to find the best Korean BBQ.  Invariably, the services comes at a cost of ambiance or service.  Not so Gen.  they've stepped up their game by offering a massive 36 item menu for an AYCE - reasonably priced at $21.99.  Their premium steak is served in 12-16 oz cuts 1/2 in thick.  All the fixins you can expect from a Korean BBQ.  The ambiance is bathed in blue hues - we'll have to come back at night instead of dusk.  Service is over the top.  As you'll have guessed, I am impressed by the sixth sense good servers have - realizing before you do, that you've finished your pop or need a refill of bean paste.  Special mention goes out to Prince, who did just that.  Have I mentioned that their hosts announce party size and the line cooks cheer?    I recommend this place and give it 5 stars for service, ambiance, cleanliness, and for the delicious food.  We'll be back.  Update: Mothers Day dinner.  Consistency ranks high with me.  This place delivers.  Having worked through the food coma this place put me in last time, I was able to take my time with dinner - I'm ex-military, so I eat like it's my last day on earth with one plate I'm sharing with a fat kid.  The crew here is the envy of any 5-Star, Michelin rated establishment.  When was the last time I seen a cleanup guy really put some elbow grease to a particularly stubborn stain?  I did.  Tonight.  Everyone works.  In a full service restaurant, table turning is key.  The faster you can have an available table the greater it is in profits to the owners.  They trained their crew exceptionally well here.  I had the privilege of being part of a tightknit unit during a particularly exhausting mission.  We were on point.  Finish each other's sentence, already done, sixth sense on point.  These guys reminded me of that tonight.

ub_O7m9hjjsvO2R5KmCmLQ.text: Wow!! One of the best Korean BBQ's I've had in Vegas thus far!!   Gen Korean BBQ House was open on Memorial Day! My family and I decided to stop in around 2:00 P.M for lunch. It was relatively busy, but we were seated promptly at the BBQ house.  The decor and ambiance is amazing. It feels very laid back and relaxing. I was quite stunned at how modern the Korean BBQ house was inside. It's a all you can eat Korean BBQ House and you pay per person.   The service was pretty good for the most part. We had a few different waiters that came by the table to help us out - either for drinks, utensils, meats etc..   We ended up selecting a wide variety of beef first and then chicken.  -Steak -Gyoza -Beef Bulgogi [2] -Hawaiian Chicken -Garlic Chicken -Sweet & Spicy Chicken  We had our plates transitioned [3] times during the course while we were at the Korean BBQ. My boyfriend ended up cooking all of the meats, but still, the food was delicious and the experience is always a lot of fun! The cuts that was brought to our table was top-end. Even the chicken breasts that were marinated had barely any fat on the cutlets. I'm very impressed with the quality of meat that was served to our table to cook. I'll be back here again!!

mxoe9676vs06FbR4KknIBQ.text: I gotta admit AYCE KBBQ doesn't excite me much but if you're looking for quantity, this is your place.  Mass amounts of raw meat and endless plates of banchans may be the success for Gen Korea BBQ House. We decided to check this place out in the city known for indulgence before the dinner crowd on a Sunday night. The hostess escorted us to a booth full with blue neon lighting and plenty of customers already packing the heat on the grill.   As we sat down, the staff heated our grill in front of us and placed 8 different banchans to accompany with our selection of entrees. With a menu filled with 36 dishes, we were completely overwhelmed from the KBBQ meats and seafood. All of those dishes come raw and are cooked by your grill. Some of the other dishes such as the jap chae, gyoza, soondooboo comes out cooked to order.  We slowly paced ourselves and started off with the beef tongue, spicy chicken, spicy baby octopus and a few side dishes. Not long after placing our orders, the dishes were delivered and we began grilling it at our table. They served three different dipping dishes which were a bit too salty for my taste. All the dishes were seasoned enough and didn't need the additional sauces. The beef slices were decent and didn't exceed the fat content like many other restaurants who uses lower standard beef cuts. After an additional order, we completed our meal and the server looked at us with an odd expression. He said we were atypical and ordered below average quantities versus the other customers. To us, we believe in quality versus quantity.  After our meal, we skipped the next 1.5 days worth of eating due to all the MSG and sodium we ate. Overall, for $22 per person for AYCE Korean BBQ this is definitely worth your waistline.

YT19NoupfzQb2UulI_atuw.text: Vegas is absolutely FULL of K-BBQ places.  Some are all you can eat, some have better quality meat, some are "hole in the wall."  Well, Gen is definitely an excellent K-BBQ experience.  The interior features a very cool and modern decor, and it was not busy at all later (around 9:30pm) on a Sunday evening.  When you arrive at your table you will find the assorted side dishes already in place for you to nibble on while you review the menu.  The menu is basically one all you can eat package, though, for $21.99.  There were about 37 items on the list ranging from assorted meats to tofu soup to gyoza dumplings to more.  You can order as much as you want to, and there is no limit to the Kalbi as there sometimes is at other places.  Soft drinks are served with unlimited refills which is a nice touch as you enjoy the various meats since you'll get thirsty.  Service was excellent!  Empty plates never sat more than a couple of minutes, and servers were always asking what else we wanted to order.  You will grill the meats yourself at your table unlike other places where the staff will come to your table and cook it.  Personally, I like the "cook it yourself" option as you can do it at your own pace without a staff member awkwardly reaching around your party to grill meat.  We ordered a large variety of meats.  The quality was quite good for an all you can eat place.  I liked the Hawaiian steak which was nicely marinated and served with a pineapple slice.  The Kalbi was also excellent.  Flavorful and, while not as sumptuously tender as I've had in the past, very good for an all you can eat place.  And, you can have as much as you want.   Overall, this was an excellent choice for all you can eat, and for $21.99 person the price is also excellent!
