EHP6ckSi3-niSRvJA6-uHw.text: My boyfriend and I have dined here several times with a few of our friends. Our group usually consists of between 4 - 5 people. We usually stay the full 2 hours. We do prefer the this location to the Sunset one.  We have always been seated immediately. The lunch is $17 per person and dinner is $21. I don't find that the difference in dinner price is worth it, unless you looove short ribs. There are obviously other differences in the menus but to me, it isn't worth it.   The quality of meats are always delicious. We eat the ENTIRE time we are there. Our friend is an amazing cook, he's usually the one to cook. Since he knows what he's doing, we cook and eat very quickly so we consume a lot of meat.   We always order premium steak, beef bulgogi, and pork cheek. It's not a lot of variety but we order a lot of each.   The service is great. They are quick to refill our drinks, take our orders, and change our grills. Even when we are on our 10th order of premium steak, they still bring it out quickly. We have never had any issues with any of our orders or the service.   Bottom line: If you like Korean BBQ and want AYCE, I definitely recommend them!

poBp4l9UPt6ppsLsFW3soQ.text: The quality of meat is pretty good here with a substantial variety of meats. Their menu seems very big but they are missing a few important Korean bbq side dishes. However, for their price point, i didn't mind that they didn't have some of my favorites. I do love that they have tofu soup and japjae on their menu!  Their desserts are basic unless you want to buy an ice cream macaroon sandwich (I'm not a fan of but they're cute and yummy). I know everyone comes for the Korean bbq but sometimes you just want a good dessert to top off dinner lol.   Overall, i think Gen is a very successful franchise bbq spot. I don't exactly understand the hype but it's a well rounded spot that has good customer service and ambiance. I'm all about consistency and quality when it comes to ANY all you can eat spots. Vegas is getting more and more saturated with Korean bbq spots but I'd definitely recommend checking Gen out if you're in the area.

5_hSaqZOCZRwclDWKbycHw.text: We had a family birthday celebration here tonight. The ambiance was excellent, food was wonderful and Brad our server was absolutely phenomenal! He was attentive, fast and really had a great attitude. He was joking with us and even when they had a system crash didn't miss a beat! Definitely a new favorite for Korean BBQ! Very well done.

3cttpEvI4lhqbCjRDgz9NQ.text: I don't judge a book by its cover but DAMNNN this place looks amazing! While I was parking, the interior lights look so appealing! Neon lights, beautiful upholstery, staff with a smile on their face. Great indicators and atmosphere settings for the start of a great meal!  AYCE was great and definitely affordable. I didn't check if there was WiFi, although dinner was so fun I didn't bother checking my phone once. There's no bike racks or outdoor dining area. Bathrooms are gender specific and clean.  Staff was on point. My server was a little unfriendly, although the bussers and other servers were nice. They checked on my table frequently to change my grill and to see if I needed anything. Ina3JvKeQ1uKLAkL4gO80A.text: We love coming here food is always on point , even tho we missed our name being called the hosted was accommodating to get our table as quick as possible even while they were full house thank you to our hostess ...!!!!!!

NLcv2hVOO6G4YwwhS01nJw.text: Gen is what I would consider the In &Out of the KBBQ category. Prior to these guys showing up in the Vegas valley all that you would ever hear from ex-Californians was "OMG you have to try Gen" "Gen is the best KBBQ place ever!!" Honestly to me it's the in-and-out nostalgia complex defined.   BUT I will say the following statements: The Gen product is consistent across their chains; the Vegas locations are on par with the Tustin, CA location.  Gen provides a environment that's comfortable and appealing to wehgukin/baeg-in. Meaning that the customer service what you expect from a standard restaurant in America (using Asian bias standard for all restaurants).   They provide a solid spread of Bon-Chon and are very prudent in ensuring that your little dishes never run empty.   The cooked dishes are OK however nothing to write in detail about. It's hard to write overflowing adjectives about the KFC and gyoza. Both are ok but not what you come here for. The main event here is the meat. First and foremost +1 star on the fact that they have Kalbi on their AYCE menu. Most KBBQ places either charge extra for Kalbi or limit it to one order.  The cuts of the meat are good quality the Chadol (brisket), Samgyubsal (pork belly) and Hangjungsal(pork jowls) are some of my standard favorites and were top notch.  The saucy meats: Beef Bulgogi, Kalbi and Spicy Pork were very good as well.  My suggestion is to starts with the unsauced meats and then do the saucy stuff; this way your taste buds are not killed from the Gochujang if you are not used to it.   For those who are just venturing into Korean foods, Gen is a good starting point to get introduced to the flavors w/o getting yelled at by an Ajima or getting blown away by the power of Gochujang.  Enjoy the wait for this place; it's worth it (as long its less than a 1/2 hour).

Ifx8EQRYnzK6VFY8LcF2lg.text: Tables visibly open and clean Abundant wait staff standing around Hostess' turned their backs and walked off after they asked our party size(2) to return and say" it will be another 5 minutes"

4oN5cFhNr-GhKARcSpuOsQ.text: Cute place, good food . Great service . Down side is no rice paper or macaroni salad which is one of our Favorite sides. Other than that it was alright

EPpDFGSWQfB8elmz6IDb5w.text: GEN! I loved going to Gen when they were still in SoCal. They used to have unmarinated short ribs and it was so delicious. Then they switched suppliers and they no longer carried the unmarinated short ribs so I stopped going as much. Then they came to Vegas but they were in Henderson and that was far. But they are pretty much the cheapest AYCE BBQ in Vegas at $21.99 per person. And now that they have opened up on Decatur and Sahara, they are much closer and maybe we can go more often!  Came here on Thursday night for dinner with my husband and some friends after my friend told us about their soft opening. Their establishment is pretty big with similar layouts to their Henderson location and Cali locations. What we did notice is that some tables, they have a hood for ventilation while other tables, their vent was on the sides of the grill.   We ordered a bunch of their beef tongue and beef belly. They were really delicious. Just be sure not to overcook them or the meat will get tough. We also got their pork belly, brisket, steak, hawaiian, steak, bulgogi, japchae, and some other things.   Everything was pretty good. Meat was decent. The japchae was so-so .. I've had better japchae at other places. It's still nice to have though so you won't be eating meat the whole time. There's salad as well. Unfortunately, they don't have the rice paper side dish yet since they are in soft opening. Though, honestly, I wouldn't count them having it all the time regardless of soft opening or grand opening cause their Henderson location doesn't always have it.   Service was pretty good. They didn't have a limit on how much you can order, which is fantastic. They used to limit you to four a few years back but now they don't! The meats got delivered super fast but who knows if that'll stay that way.   They were actually supposed to open earlier. They were working on getting some disposable grill plates for the grills since they are really hard to clean. They figured that it may be easier for them to just dispose it after it's been used. However, the problem with disposable grills is that it causes a lot of smoke when you use it. And because of that, they couldn't pass the health department with it. In the end, they had to scrap that idea and go along with the traditional grills.   If Gen could get the adjustable hoods like the ones in Korea or the ones at Hobak and Doh, it would be so much better. Even though the establishment is brand new, their ventilation is horrible. Normally, a place takes a while for it to stink up with BBQ smell but I walked out smelling like some grilled short ribs and keep in mind that they are still in soft opening!

9INX9UMccqXMBUA_JxOaDQ.text: Great food , great restaurant. Awesome restaurant. Boyd and mizzo were great service. As well as Kalee awesome host! Definitely will come again !

m4ObrZEk8YLkQKm6Q9P2QQ.text: Best Korean bbq food ever, first timer too and I loved it. Service was great, definitely coming back all you can eat ! Loved their choice of salad

6lTTkEjBRlZcg3xC4t6Dfw.text: My family and I have been to the Gen location at Henderson and we are happy that they opened this new and closer location. The staff delivered excellent customer service. Our waiter Anthony B. made sure we were well taken care of and succeeded our expectations!  Everyone was very attentive and worked great as a team. The food was savory and hit all the right taste buds. My favorites are the brisket and the bbq beef ribs. Don't forget to add a macaroon ice cream sandwich to top off your whole experience. I recommend everyone try this Gen Korean BBQ place. We plan to come back soon and maybe even have a party here!

PGi-MWaNWcd7_jXOimjx0w.text: Not one of my favorite Korean BBQ's. 1) they do not oil the grill how other KBBQ's do. 2) you have to remove the meat yourself before they exchange your charred grill. I guess I'm not used to that because at Hwaro they always remove the meat from the grill for you. I also disliked how they did not have a lot of sides that were AYCE, and no dessert was included.

CDzM1fbj-Un2BUmSavfAtg.text: So this is my first tome eating here with my family and the man Austin is the best I have never had customer service like I had here and I work in the customer service industry but this place hands down is the best yet!!!!

vEOa6SsIEYbBv5YOn7KqxA.text: If you are Korean, don't come here... The side dishes don't taste good. The kimchi doesn't taste authentic. The price is cheap. And you're going to get that cheap quality.

etv-cHgi5ym32jSObEWqUg.text: Great food, awesome atmosphere and outstanding service! First timer and my whole party was really impressed. You can't try everything because there's so much greatness to choose from. So we'll just have to keep going back again and again!

7qXgOeTmgR7yIx6Rd-ln0w.text: I have always been a huge fan of Gen. I have lost count of how many times I've been here over the past 2 years and I have never had a bad experience. The wait times are sometimes annoying but it is always worth it for the food. Unfortunately this last time I went made me question whether I should go back again. This past time I went I was with a party of 10, which of course is a large party so we knew we were going to have to wait a while. The wait time the hostess gave us was 45 minutes. Which we though was great. We had also asked her to not split up our party since I know sometimes they do that with larger parties. She assured me we would not be split up. After waiting 45 minutes we asked the hostess how much longer she thought it was going to be, and she pointed at a large group at a table and said she was going to seat us at that large table and that the guests at the table were paying and then leaving. She said it would me no more than 20 minutes. We waited another 30 minutes and watched the staff clear that table, then they called our names after waiting for a total of 1 hour and 15 minutes. When she walked us in she walked us to a different table that the other hostess said we were waiting on and tried to split us up into 3 different tables, which is something I had asked them not to do since the beginning. I voiced my frustration and after speaking to the manager she reluctantly moved us to the table we waited an extra 30 minutes for.   Once we were seated the food and service was exceptional as always. It just really bothered me that they had us wait an extra 30 minutes on top of the 45 originally and told us they were putting us at one specific table that we waited the extra 30 minutes for then put us at another table that was open the whole time!   I probably will not be coming back to this location, instead I will go back to the original Las Vegas Gen at Galleria Mall.

EF7kCWE1SJhsYSDqu6vUCw.text: Service is way better than the Henderson location. Kenny is a great server, but we were checked on by multiple people for drinks, sides, and more to order!

l6girHTzsl_nEeQN_AFebQ.text: The best Korean BBQ place in Las Vegas! "AYCE" price is cheap but all food are fresh and delicious, service speed I can rate them 5 star! Also our waiter 's name is JOE,  he's friendly and super nice guy, take care our very well! All other staff are nice too, we petty sure will come back next time as soon as possible.

P8DXJSG0K2wfv7bP_uTEsw.text: It was alright. Not as good as the location in Henderson, we went around 2pm and the service was good but the food... the soup and rice was not warm but the dumplings were really good!  The meat quality was kind of bad, the spicy pork was sweet not spicy and the bulgogi was very strange.

fFbSZDfh0qebiqbjc6IZVw.text: So glad that they opened a location closer to me because I hated to drive all the way to Henderson for AYCE Korean BBQ. The menu is a little different from the one in Henderson but who can complain when you can get all that food for $21.99!! I would've given the place 5 stars but our waiter was really rude. Pushing plates to just so she can hurry and get on to her next table.

1lvVi1rtWqhmX4e-hv8ImQ.text: Great food and great price. A few of my friends and I've going to the sunset location. We've tried other KBBQ places but this one seems to be the best thus far to us. Great ambiance and staff as well!

o1g_EZDm-9N-WEUYkqvbTA.text: This place has such a nice vibe. I was here on a Friday and the music was like a night club vibe and really good selection of food to choose from.

IKS-bILIldfQTORTtvJi8A.text: Everyone at this location is super friendly we had a party of 10 for lunch and all of the servers always checked on us and made sure we had everything we needed. Our drinks were never empty, our grills were always cleaned and all of our dirty plates were taken. Our server Kenny was awesome and Eugene made sure we were taken care of.

oUk_dNULClv3CfHk42AEHQ.text: The better Gen. Our server was named rufio. Pretty good food, man. No long lines. Service quick. And friendly. Go for it.

P7ZlTbmx21UaPC3ZdX_H9Q.text: This is probably my favorite Korean spot. Came to celebrate one of my coworkers birthdays. The food was great but the service from Boid was even better he made our experience top notch.

Jz1aAbyVlMUc0FFItf6Sig.text: Best kbbq in town!!!! I actually did not expect how high quality of meats were. I was impressed! Much better than the one in Henderson. Keep it up!!

efhqB8hnhP8oTvsWVbTH-Q.text: This place is so ono. The smoked garlic pork belly is so mouth watering. The beef kalbi and bulgogi is my favorite choice to order here. They have the best quality of meat for an all you can eat kbbq and for a good price. The staff are really friendly and helpful in deciding what to order. The only thing bad is the music is too loud that the waitress couldn't hear anyone ordering, and we would have to speak really loud to have a conversation. But other then that, everything from the food and customer service was excellent.

qX_uz2OAEtoBDbnzr-pNJg.text: Love coming here with friends! We normally come in a group of 10-15 people so it's nice that they have seating with enough grills to accommodate us all. They play great music and the waitresses are always around to fill drinks, take orders, and change the grills!

ISaAhqYRq8q-qSKkpUdjuw.text: I have been to a lot of Gen locations in cali and so far this Gen location in Vegas is good. We had Austin B. as our server and he did a really good job serving us and recommending good food.

K1yAbEJK38ITof9aNqx88A.text: I've been to the one in Henderson when it first opened and I wasn't impressed. My favorite has always been Tofu Hut. I went to this one last night and the choices have gotten a lot better. The waiter was awesome and the macaroon ice cream sandwiches were good but really hard to bite into.

iACGVixrj-HFx6a_ClfFZg.text: Best value BBQ place in town. We went in on a hot summer day, 110+; wish the A/C could be better!

RTSEwuut2pauMSQUqJX-sw.text: A lunch for two cost me $80 due to a cashier error. Called several times to resolve only to be stonewalled in denial. Going to have to call their corporate to get it resolved. Shady business practices!

gT5YVu4HSgwFZcbF5vOALA.text: Place is crappy . The workers were very rude and disrespectful. No help was taking action during my stay here . It was a very uncomfortable environment

puybsia6zE9upb0JsRQG0A.text: Took my girlfriend here for her birthday dinner. We walked in and.were seated right away. The menu was all you can eat and like most all you can eat places they will charge extra if you do not eat everything. We started.off with the Hawaiian Pork Belly, Gen Bulgogi (korean beef), and the Korean Fried chicken(KFC) which was already cooked and similar to Chinese Orange Chicken. The Hawaiian Pork Belly was awesome. We liked it so much we had a second order. The Bulgogi was good  also. We ordered Garlic Chicken and the Briskett next along with some vegetables. The Briskett was extremely thin and cooked really fast. It was goid but I thought needed more seasoning. The Garlic Chicken was also good but I'm from Hawaii and Hawaiian garlic chicken is much better than it was here.   Overall the atmosphere was great and the reataurant was very clean. The service was really good.One of the best service I have experienced in Vegas. I definitely would reccomend this place to friends.

Q63l2EaNvKxo1iftc1ZGgg.text: We made reservations which was a good idea, we had maybe a 10 min wait. Our waiter was very kind and nice and made sure he took care of us in the timely matter. I feel the price is right and the experience was awesome.

VJF38coPOc2mmxrYDYTuhg.text: My favorite restaurant pound for pound in Las Vegas. Period. We come here at least once a week.

xbpUkiVCg4ovGR8nGEelag.text: I went to this place on Saturday morning, when I went in the ladies ask if I want lunch or dinner. I say lunch and she give me lunch menu. After I sit down I order the food right away. And I wait 20 for minute and nothing show up. They told me they have a system problem. But I saw people who come after me already get their meats. I am okay with the wait, but the thing that really ruin the experience is when I going to paid, they charge me dinner price, I explain I choose lunch and I only have a lunch menu. But they told me it is dinner all day. So I have no choice but to paid the dinner price even I didn't eat a single dinner menu food. NOT GOING TO VISIT AGAIN.

fOmXrLAqN-2BBcKe4lwyDA.text: 5 stars for the service alone!  Our server was Justin and from start to finish he and all the other servers take care of you. They always asked if we were ok, if we wanted to order more or needed the grill to be changed. Also since they order direct to an iPad the meats come out so quick.  Only thing that needs improvement is a better ventilation system.   As of 1/6 they still don't have their liquor license

jSmniTpVtR-atmK7cQz1DQ.text: Been to this place several times and loving it... BUT not today!  Ate with the family and in the middle of our dinner - a lady named LYNETTE came and hand in our bill.  I told her we're not done yet and she informed us that there's a two-hour limit (which we know).  I told her that we were there for less than one hour and she said she will check since they clock everyone.  I told her you better!  She came back later and apologize in a very quick fashion!  Good thing that our server Neil came and did a better job of apologizing- I did tell him that I was really offended by that lady's action - only to find out that she was a manager... Wow I don't think I will pass her as a manager!  She definitely needs retraining in customer service!!!! And my advice, if you are to eat here check your watch for the time!!!!

rZupPjnF9i9t7Ngs8HYxMA.text: The food was amazing and so was my waitress Jade!! She has a beautiful soul and deserves an award for the stellar service that she provided! With a variety of over 30 items to choose from she def helped out with my decision making process and has very good suggestions might I add! Such a pleasant experience and I will be back!!

G0fUjuirf1AS5KvZ5MUJTA.text: Just tried Korean BBQ for the first time and Gen came highly recommended. It did not disappoint! Our waitress Criza was so helpful and recommended what we should try for our first time. The food was absolutely delicious, the staff was amazing and attentive, and the atmosphere was hip and fun! Definitely recommend the adult Caprisun and the K. F. C.  Fun and delicious experience!

E-B6MhGHHP4rD6rXEnoRwA.text: Was closed at 9:30 for maintenance. I showed up at 8 and said they were going to let us eat for 40 mins before kicking everyone out

uBQH-hnauF0ZUGRuIJUsCA.text: Would go again! Amazing service! Our waiter was willing to explain how the menu worked and also walked us through with cooking everything. Very attentive! For the price of $22 all you can eat (per person) I would say this is such a bargain. All the meat we ordered was amazing. I can say that without a doubt I will be coming again when my friends and family visit.

rA3jppNH5wXuzP80TD7NFg.text: 4.5 stars  The KBBQ here is solid all-around, and they offer a lot of choices of meat. Banchan (side-dish) is decent, not the greatest. I really like their salad dressing tho.   My fav items include the marinated short ribs, premium top sirloin steak, brisket, cajun calamari, cajun shrimp, and premium pork belly.   Clubby atmosphere. It's loud and dark with electro music playing in the background. A downside for me personally to this place is that it doesn't have the authentic feel of a Korean bbq joint. I didn't see any Korean workers, and you have to ask for a lot of the little things like sesame oil, samjang, garlic, etc.   In the end, $22 for all the variety of meats makes this place worth it.

YwhTyyTR5eGrAfNhAvHmHg.text: Very good Korean food. Great place to go if your hungry as it's all you can eat. Price point very good. I would definitely come back to this place. Great selection also.

BHgosub4BJwgqiA4ndMkeg.text: WELCOME TO GEN!  I'm pretty sure this is my favorite phrase of 2018.  This place is great. A plethora of sides and main dish selections. Great service. Seriously, they might as well save me a table because I go here more often than I should and I am never disappointed.

NZVNSMRu4I_VDVotAXqsUw.text: First time having Korean BBQ and I must admit, it was a great experience! This location has a great ambience and a very modern decor.   We started with the KFC, which was pretty good. Then we got the volcano, which was unnecessarily spicy. Not worth getting. The gyoza was solid.  We got the brisket, which when they brought out looked very different than the second time they brought it out. Kind of confusing- overall we ordered five orders of brisket and two looked very different and tasted worse.  Spicy bulgogi (pork) was very yummy. Corn cheese when you ask, so good! They offer chicken, which is very cool for people who don't eat pork or beef.  The meat was pretty low quality but for 22$ and all you can eat, that's to be expected. However, the service was great and the line wasn't too long on a Friday night, so overall a very nice experience.

oYIWWBI-_MYPsvE-hDQCyg.text: Absolutely Favorite Korean bbq place to go here in Las Vegas and California. But this location especially, they have absolutely great customer service. George was our serve but a few other servers helped us out as well Kaithlyn I believe was one. They all work together and I love that cause it helps give you the best experience.   The food here is always delicious. From the salad to all the appetizers and the meats. Our favorites are the chadol (beef belly), the beef brisket and beef bulgogi. We always get extra brisket sauce and salad dressing sauce to dip our meats and gyozas in.   We often come during lunch because it's such a great deal. It's only $16.99 for all you can eat which is awesome, we get around 8 plates of meat for the both of us usually and come out more than satisfied.   I'm so glad they built this location, it's a lot closer to us and local to anyone that comes to the strip. We live up north and it's so much nicer to drive only like 30 minutes vs an hour to the Henderson location.

aEt6GBS01sxf4Cdb8PskAA.text: Good food, service was okay.   Not much else to say! I highly recommend for those that are first time KBBQ-goers!

RfaD3knUBO3kVspvWB9BxA.text: My husband wanted to try this place out tonight.   He really likes Korean BBQ, I am not sure why you would want to go to a restaurant and cook your own food but whatever.   We tried the Hawaiian Steak that marinade was delicious.  Of course we got brisket and galbi short ribs and my husband got pork belly (by then the kids and I were too full).  Everything was good but I have had better.  The kids and I also got a macaroon icecream sandwich each.  For me the best part was the service all the waiters were very attentive and they changed out our grill two times.  When we ordered the meat would come out in about a minute or two.  So quick.  Also the water cups were never empty and they had the Stanley Cup Playoffs showing on all television screens. #GoKnightsGo!

PKBVpwCmZsSR_b6TykORMA.text: I have to say this place was pretty awesome. Such a very large selection of marinated Meats and cooked items to select from. Seats are very comfortable and the ambiance is the definitely trendy. I would be crazy to leave out the great prices for the all you can eat. Definitely would recommend trying this place if you're in the neighborhood and if you're not in the neighborhood get to the neighborhood check it out.

5dxbjcqazPDPkmu4sX-x6Q.text: From my 5 year old: This place is really pretty. It's full of yummy food. I love it. My favorite food is the short ribs.

OJfSTNl32hrY_O_DoV3d3w.text: I really like this place.. Trendy atmosphere nice lighting.. A great place to take a date! Can't beat the price $21.99 for ayce and they serve it to you,  no need to get up and get your own food.. The quality and flavors are on point! I pretty much enjoyed everything we ordered.. Spicy baby octopus was my favorite, all the meat tasted fresh and well seasoned.. There was a manager there that was very accommodating and welcoming,  she made sure our meal was exceptional!! Along with all the servers they provided excellent service.. Sorry I didn't catch any names... I will definitely come here more often for my kbbq fix!! Good job Gen keep up the good work!!

A61WzW_L33o9V-Wz6ArLeg.text: We finally tried this place and had a very OK meal.  Nothing stood out, some shrimp tasted like farmed out catfish... selection and flavor just weren't comparable to other places.     A few people told me this place was better than hwaro but I now believe my friends were high or something.  No wait here compared to other places we tried that night.  Now I know why.

l-6-lPBBDNnGq8uWjlNU7g.text: Came here when the squad and I took a trip to Vegas -- it was a good time with plenty of food. The restaurant is spacious, seating is comfortable, and service was consistent and quick. Plenty of meat options to indulge in. I ordered mango soju here and it made for a good pregame for night time festivities on the strip!

2rjTs_Z-mSGOnky_yOBeng.text: First time here by my granddaughter recommended, this is by far the best Korean restaurant I've been. Service is quick and the variety of types of meat Is awesome. Price is so reasonable. My favorite is the Cajun pork belly and Hawaiian belly, thick and tender. They don't serve too much of the fillers which is great. I highly recommend this place when you are in Las Vegas.

OcOcSNA24izyy0vY1VJPYA.text: It is 11pm and they are closed.. Shouldn't advertise that they close at midnight.. I thought it would be nice to have Korean BBQ during this cold night, but now we have to find somewhere else to eat..

MlOdwcKXIqJy7fFB7TqJLg.text: I LOVE Korean BBQ. It MAY have something to do with the fact that I'm Korean LOL.  FRESH Ingredients, fast service, super clean restaurant. Love the dim lighting for a relaxing Time engorging myself with meat on top of meat surrounded by meat.

zna52PSCH2RZ9oAwun1mZg.text: Great place. Just went with friends who aren't vegan and was able to get Sondoobo (spicy tofu stew) and an order of glass noodles! Lots of the sides are vegan friendly, just ask to be sure. My friends did all you can eat and the server told me I could still get things off the menu, $5 for japchae (glass noodle) and $5 for the Stew, and the mixed mushroom and vegetables would also be $5 if I ordered those. Not much options but enough to feel satisfied on a night out!

ttEcU7Wrgbtn4q8bEdc7XQ.text: Amazing food! It's easy to get full here and it's definitely worth the money. I especially fell in love with their KFC (Korean fried chicken) the most out of everything there.

K6miFqWuF0ii0luXChgpug.text: Loved this place! Good atmosphere, friendly staff, extremely affordable and clean! We had beef brisket, calamari and veggies. The dipping sauce was awesome! Fresh food, great flavor. I'll definitely go back!

VQc316ct1sePIGa6aES0vA.text: Best overall experience from service to food selection. Thank you for taking care of us so well. Recommend the spicy octopus

41jClDoKGx1IYvIK6ZmN9Q.text: While looking for a KBBQ to eat at, a few places we wanted to eat at were either super busy or closing soon so Gen KBBQ it was. It was also very busy when we arrived but they closed later than other nearby spots so we ended up having dinner here. No disappointments though since we knew what to expect and always enjoy the food at any Gen KBBQ. The only downfall is that they don't served steamed egg which I enjoy with my KBBQ. Anyway, the price is reasonable since it's an AYCE joint and the food is good. Nothing out of the ordinary here - just a delicious KBBQ dinner!

dR0vvfc8-_hEIY9adaeyNQ.text: I live in state about 10 years and I ate over hundred Korean restaurant over here. Be an Asian I love Korean food especially BBQ. However, I have to say the food and service right here is awful in my whole experience. 1. It's my first time to seen a bbq restaurant grill to do bbq without oil. We checked with a waiter and he said we don't use oil here. Excuse me ? With out oil do you guys know how hard to cook meat? 2. Each time I must call by myself if I would have a services. No buddy helps cook and no buddy coming. 3. Food like fast food, come on.   And yes , the price is really good. But I won't come again

oKN7DDP-XGzHSzD6YHRcgg.text: This place is pretty good, not going to lie. The only reason why it's only 3 stars is because the service was terrible. Our server barely checked up on us, we had to call different waiters to bring us the stuff we needed.   One of the waiters who is a Caucasian male wearing glasses gave us a huge attitude when we asked for an extra bowl of rice. He even gave one of my friends a dirty look.  Sad that it's such a good place with great food, only for the waiters to be so unfriendly and lacking in customer service mannerisms. We understand that it was busy, but being treated like that was so uncalled for.

w2eMb3KyMMQeL6cdBWZYxg.text: ** best lunch prices in town. Great atmosphere and roomy not running into limited spacing as well as parking in a random neighborhood compared to other places.  Great on the basics nothing really to complain. Decent happy hour menu.   Biggest thing that turned me off was the red wine marinated pork belly. The color came out purple and didn't really add much to the flavor for me. Could be just me from not being able to get past the looks. Other than that I would recommend this place for first timers as well as seasoned kbbq goers!

CGqgzX9aKu18UrclHQgdgg.text: Modern, clean and with great selection of food and reasonable price! Too bad they don't have my favorite steam eggs!!! Otherwise I would give 5 stars!

-_UH-FSuE8xUwiaTDiePOA.text: Super awesome service at this location! Suppppeeerrrr friendly staff! Food came out quick! Only $21.99 for all you can eat meats and seafoods and the tastiest banchans (Korean side dishes like kim chee etc.) I especially love the spicy baby octopus! So yummy! Marinated in Korean sauce and it's not too spicy. Just a little tiny kick. The waiters are super adamant on continuously changing the grill which is so important when eating bbq. Our waitress was from Maui (Hawaii) and she was the sweetest! Love coming here and now so happy to have a gen on my side of town!

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That green salad has an amazing dressing!
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy baby octopus and whole piece of steak!
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket (thinly sliced beef) cooks up in seconds I would say!

Db69GYoQXfNd8aTuoPbvJA.text: The best unlimited Korean bbq restaurant in Las Vegas!! They have a great customer service, every thing comes out within minutes and they periodically check on you to make sure everything is good. The unlimited menu is definitely awesome, loved the volcano chicken and gyoza from the appetizer section. I would recommend the rib eye as it's sooo delicious! The only downside is that they have no dessert on the menu, but you can purchase your macaron ice cream separately.

Qfrk-FhK1BEDlKWAp2bokw.text: AYCE Korean BBQ dinner all 36 items for $21.99. Price no other can beat. Service always amazing each time we dine here. Fast with drink refills and grill changes. Meats are pretty average quality. Satisfying for our palate. Will always enjoy korean food because of their meat options and side dishes. Theyir first location began in Henderson next to Galleria mall. Being new, they had more.menu items and through time, it decreased. It was nice for them to have appetizer options. My fave was their fried calamari topped with sriracha/mayo sauce. They no longer serve appetizers that as it might've been a budget issue. Don't exactly know. Other than that, meats are marinated well, boasting of flavor. Our usual is beef bulgogi, galbi (short ribs), smoked garlic pork belly, premium steak ribeye, and shrimp. Their chicken options are great also it's just I don't have much patience cooking it, takes longer than beef. Drinks are additional charge on top of ayce price. Sahara location isn't far. If your visiting Vegas, it's conveniently in the middle. Main landmark is Palace Station, head west to Decatur on Sahara, look left then you got AYCE KBBQ!

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just about to grill!

BXnr8iWuSZZTLOk9SbywsA.text: I came here on my mini Vegas 4 day vaca. 2nd time here. I came here in August 2018 and it was super bomb! See my previous review. This time seated within 5 minutes while they turned over a table. Jade my server was very good. She kept me well-stocked. You can order off a menu of meat smogasborg of around 36 items for dinner. My favs are the galbi and brisket. The belly and steak are thick and take awhile to grill. Red wine pork belly, beef tongue, spicy bulgogi were great. The beef intestines were chewy. Iam adventurous with food but I didn't like those innards. I tried the prawns and baby octopus which were the main seafood items. Anyways, I ate until my heart was content. The kimchi and the sides were nothing to write home about. They also give you 3 dipping salts. I ask for their excellent house spicy sauce. Service at this Vegas location is really good. My 1st visit was one of the top 10 best ever service I have ever experienced. They tag team so any server or helper will drop by and check on you. This visit they checked on me often but in August I had 3 asking if I needed my grill changed or to order more off the menu in like a few minutes. Amazing service during my summer visit. I saw Gen has a few Bay Area locations and they have Yelp reviews with poor service. Not likely at this Vegas location. Not sure about the Henderson location but reviews look like service is good there too. I hit up Gen each time going to Vegas now. A great new tradition!!

KQeDVwTjOTg-b9cdGTAl0w.text: This was my first visit to this establishment. Korean barbecue is one of my favorite cuisines in Atlanta so I was super excited to try this out in Vegas. We drove past it the day before and I was told that it was a pretty popular spot so we decided to try it today.  Immediately upon walking in I was impressed with the decor of the restaurant.  It is very modern and has an upscale ambiance. For some reason it reminds me of the W Hotel, probably because of the blue lights LOL   When I first entered it took a while for them to turn around and greet me but once I was seated and our server came everything was great. They have an all-you-can-eat menu for $21.99 each. The menu stated there are 36 different items to choose from, we stuck with the beef bulgogi which is my favorite (because I like marinated meats), so we had several servings of that. We also ordered the an order of the vegetables and mushrooms, Hawaiian steak, and Hawaiian chicken. All of the marinades were very delicious and I was very impressed. They had most of the usual side dishes that you'll find such as salads, radish, kimchi, potato salad, pickled cucumber and even coleslaw.  I ate a whole bowl of a potato salad LOL   The service was very prompt and the servers were very attentive. The other servers would stop by and check on us as they pass by even though they weren't are assigned waiter. I always love going to restaurants like that so you don't have to sit and wait on one particular person. I think every restaurant should do this.  My overall experience was very good, I definitely will be back again. My only gripe is, the meal didn't include a dessert, which most Korean barbecue at least give you coffee or a small ice cream or something (there's a separate charge). I give it an overall 4 stars would recommend you try it out.

nMmoQEm1Nl9bGJ0dh0qKYw.text: Friendly, clean, and not too smoky spot for Korean BBQ. Our server Austin was on point and made sure we were taken care of. He suggested some good soju and meats to start the evening.  We started with the odds and ends first. Intestines and tongue were good, but needed quite a bit of cooking time. The volcano chicken was not as spicy as I thought it would be, but was one of my favorites. The ribs were a definite hit too. Andrew the bartender made a tasty and pretty soju mojito. Banchans (side dishes) were refilled frequently which was nice. Dinner service got busier later in the evening causing a slight delay in our table getting the meats we ordered, so some of the table mates were a little hungry in between orders.   Lastly, for large groups, you can only split the check 3 ways. They can take 2 different credit cards and the third payment would be cash for the remainder of the balance. Which made math time extra fun after we had a round of drinks, but we figured it eventually. Overall, decent bbq, good service, and cool atmosphere.

bgPorG1WdlrbphvbhYDQ0w.text: AYCE: I have to say, for the price at the time that we went (dinner) $22.00 approximately per person with over 35 items to choose from and all-you-can-eat in a clean and modern environment, I was really impressed.  If you've seen any of my other KBBQ reviews, you know I am a sucker for Kalbi mainly LA-Kalbi.  Here they have Gen signature kalbi which is not too bad.  It is not as tender as going to other a la carte KBBQ restaurants but since they do not limit you on how many you can order, I was just impressed with the overall experience.  Perhaps you can choose to grill the kalbi more on the rare side for a more tender mouth feel.  But I did enjoy the 'tae-jee buhlgogi' spicy pork a lot and the chadol=brisket was adequate so long as you don't overcook it and use the dipping sauce.  There were other great choices like a huge bowl of japchae noodles and a simple but yummy sunduboo tofu soup.  Not to mention ppan-jhan side dishes were refillable.  Service-wise: they were for the most part very attentive and fountain beverages were refillable not commonly seen in Asian restaurants.  There is music but despite other reviews it wasn't obnoxiously loud.  I'd definitely go back if I want an affordable KBBQ that can accommodate a variety of taste buds.  BTW, I braved the Volcano chicken contrary to the WARNING on the menu.  It is a slow burn that can get you over time but when you have some Korean blood in you I think you'll be ok like I was (wink!)  But try it, there isn't much to lose.  I wish it had more chicken and less breading.  This is a great treasure here in Las Vegas's "china town"

Fdn9zSYMXhxwLqF8ycanGg.text: It's good and I'm glad they have it here now.  The first time I went was in Irvine California.  The ambience is cool for casual dates, hanging with friends or just grubbin with the fam.  It felt like a lounge with blue lights and loud music. The meat choices were about a page long and the banchan was good.  The only thing I am not a fan of is fish cake.  And for some reason their japchae tasted off but other than that, this is a nice hangout for Korean bbq gluttony.

uydi8tFD5uygoNRfcFw1Iw.text: Overall bad experience.  First, the seating in the place is inefficient. If you come with a party of six or more people, be prepared to wait for 45 minutes. This could have been totally avoided if they sat smaller groups at the respective small booths, but for some reason they don't do that.  It was frustrating to see a couple eating at the "large seating section" meant for larger groups.      No sense of urgency.  This is ironic as this restaurant has a time limit. It takes too long for the wait staff to refill drinks, take more orders, bus tables and generally speaking, tend to customers.  We had to write a list down of "refill soda, more X, Y, Z, extra spoon, etc" because the time in between a waiter checking on us was a rare occasion and the list of things needed kept growing.  Hiring a few extra workers would do this place wonders.

End8YFZg0LUT8V7mXR3lGA.text: Great price for all you can eat ($21.99/person dinner. Not sure if prices change on other days). I liked that they had the table prepped with the given sides before we sat down. Our server explained to us how it worked since it was my boyfriend's first time. The plates of meat that we ordered came immediately. There was enough meat per plate for 2-4 people, depending on what you order. The servers were prompt when it came to changing out the grill during our meal. I loved that the macaroon ice cream sandwich was in a fridge for us to look at right when we entered. Made me excite to get dessert as it was delicious and not to sweet. The atmosphere was well lit even though it was dim lighting with cool blue lights. They were waiting to get their liquor license for their bar. We will return once that happens. The service was great! Favorites: Cajun shrimp, KFC (Korean Fried Chicken), chicken with fondue jalapeno dip, thumbs up that had the ribs and #1, the mushrooms and I liked the green tea salt. Not sure if Korean BBQ places do fish, but I felt that's all that would've been a nice choice. Great place for groups or a date. BTW, they have a couple of TVs at the bar if your special someone wanted to catch up on sports.

xPE0-ltcXU94NwKrElWIog.text: Came here with my family, which was a group of 6. They do apply a 18% gratuity for a party of that size, which was no problem but that means the server can lack service and they will still get almost a 20% tip. The reason for my review being 3 stars was they had barely any vegetarian options. I had to eat glass noodles (10/10) and peppers, onions and mushrooms for $21, which was there all you can eat price. My family, who eat meat, seemed to enjoy it but vegetables and noodles did not fill me up. I was hoping they had tofu, but nope. If I was a meat-eater, this place would have been better, very cool idea. Also, ventilation of this restaurant was bad, left the restaurant REEKING of bbq smoke. NOT VEGETARIAN FRIENDLY.

ubpoatkLKTOTn9jNNCoOOg.text: Great BBQ AYCE place to take the kids. The weekend price is all day ($21.99) and kids are measured to determine the price. I think over 50" is full price? We've been here a few times. This last time we had Anthony as our waiter and he was very kind and continually checked on us throughout. The meats were great and the Galbi and the spicy pork was the favorite. Food comes out very quickly and they ask to change the grill plate a few times. Sides were pretty standard, but limited in comparison to other AYCE places. There aren't any extra appetizers available or desserts included so that's the main reason for the star loss. You can order a macron ice cream sandwich for like $3.50 extra? The place is huge so the wait is minimal, which is a big bonus for us! Customer service has always been on point, which is a big reason we have been back a few times.
